fauna.name: Brown Armoredillo Pup
fauna.comments: Introduced in The New Threat, April 2004

fauna.name: Spiny Armoredillo
fauna.offense: Slashing damage. Been known to leap into the air and do an unusual spinning attack capable to great amounts of damage.
fauna.treasure: Food, also ocassionally drops a Small Armoredillo Hide.
fauna.comments:
Relatively quick but not as fast as a Shreth.
Thanks to Og the One Eye for the data on this creatures magic resistance.

fauna.name: Brown Armoredillo
fauna.offense: A biting attack that does little damage if you have armor on, as well as a leaping spin that can do massive damage if caught from behind.
fauna.weakness: Susceptible to acid and flame-based weapons. Also resistant to bludgeoning damage.
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops a Small Armoredillo Hide. Mostly magic components, pyreals, and food.
fauna.comments: The big brother of the Spiny Armoredillo, these guys differ only where they're lurking.

fauna.name: Stony Armoredillo Pup
fauna.comments: Found during A New Threat.

fauna.name: Spikey Armoredillo
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops an Armoredillo Hide ().
fauna.comments: Data gathered early in beta 2.

fauna.name: Stony Armoredillo
fauna.weakness: Low piercing attacks seem to work best
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops an Armoredillo Hide ().

fauna.name: Bronze Armoredillo Pup
fauna.comments: Introduced in The New Threat, April 2004

fauna.name: Sandy Armoredillo Pup
fauna.comments: Found during A New Threat.

fauna.name: Bronze Armoredillo
fauna.offense: A biting attack that does little damage if you have armor on, as well as a leaping spin that can do massive damage if caught from behind.
fauna.weakness: The weaknesses should be Susceptible to Piercing, Cold, and Electricity, and Resistant to Bludgeoning and Fire.
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops Large Armoredillo Hide or a Bronze Armoredillo Spine. Mostly magic components, pyreals, and sometimes armor pieces.
fauna.comments: Keep them in front of you. Thanks to Topheron for magic D.

fauna.name: Sandy Armoredillo
fauna.offense: A biting attack that does little damage if you have armor on, as well as a leaping spin that can do massive damage if caught from behind.
fauna.weakness: Susceptible to acid and flame-based weapons. Also resistant to bludgeoning damage. Moves very slowly.
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops Large Armoredillo Hide or a Sandy Armoredillo Spine. Mostly magic components, pyreals, and sometimes armor pieces. Has been known to drop jewelry, both magic and non-magical.
fauna.comments: Keep them in front of you.

fauna.name: Polardillo
fauna.comments: Submitted by Shobuck Jr (Leafcull)

fauna.name: Freshwater Armoredillo
fauna.offense: A biting attack that does little damage if you have armor on, as well as a leaping spin that can do massive damage if caught from behind.
fauna.weakness: Susceptible to acid and flame-based weapons. Also resistant to bludgeoning damage.
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops Large Armoredillo Hide or a Grey Spine. Mostly magic components, pyreals, and sometimes armor pieces.
fauna.comments: Keep them in front of you. They spawn in packs, but only one seems to move at a time. Since they're often lurking underwater, by the time you figure out that there are actually five where you only thought there was one, it'll be too late.

fauna.name: Shore Armoredillo

fauna.name: Island Armoredillo

fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops Sturdy Armoredillo Hide or an Island Armoredillo Spine.
fauna.comments: Vulnerabilities thanks to Latisi XP updated by Briciu.

fauna.name: Auroch Yearling
fauna.offense: These young aurochs are naturally peacefull, though even when angered they are not very dangerous.

fauna.name: Auroch Fire Yearling
fauna.offense: Initial bludgeoning charge, head-swiping melee attack. Can breathe non-magical flame.
fauna.treasure: Fire Auroch steaks, which restore health when consumed. May drop an Auroch Horn.
fauna.comments: Easy enough to kill when alone, but are rarely alone. When attacking, keep an eye on the radar for marauding Bulls and Cows.

fauna.name: Auroch Cow
fauna.offense: Initial bludgeoning charge attack, head-swiping melee attack.
fauna.treasure: Cooking Stamp.
fauna.comments: Will travel great distances to protect Yearlings and assist Bulls.

fauna.name: Auroch Bull
fauna.offense: These bulls are naturally peaceful and only attack if provoked. Initial bludgeoning charge attack, head-swiping melee attack.
fauna.treasure: Sides of beef. Occasionally drops Auroch Horn () or a Cooking Stamp.
fauna.comments: They are sometimes found in large (20+) herds with other cattle. Starting stampedes is not advised. Will protect Yearlings.

fauna.name: Auroch Fire Cow
fauna.offense: Initial bludgeoning charge, head-swiping melee attack. Can breathe non-magical flame.
fauna.treasure: Fire Auroch steaks, which restore health when consumed. Sometimes drop an Auroch Horn () or a Fire Auroch Hide or a Cooking Stamp.
fauna.comments: Easy enough to kill when alone, but are rarely alone. When attacking, keep an eye on the radar for marauding Bulls and Yearlings.

fauna.name: Auroch Fire Bull
fauna.offense: Initial bludgeoning charge, head-swiping melee attack. Can breathe non-magical flame.
fauna.treasure: Fire Auroch steaks, which restore health when consumed. Occsasionally drops a Fire Auroch Horn also drops Fire Auroch Hide & Cooking Stamp.
fauna.comments: Easy enough to kill when alone, but are rarely alone. When attacking, keep an eye on the radar for marauding Cows and Yearlings.
fauna.location: Generaly found mostly in the Dessert

fauna.name: Straw Target Drudge

fauna.name: Oak Target Drudge
fauna.comments: Thanks to Bran-Li of Leafcull for image.

fauna.name: Drudge Skulker
fauna.offense: Fists and feet, usually. Has been seen using small slashing and piercing weapons such as daggers, knives, khanjar, and jambiya. Nothing bigger than a shortsword.
fauna.weakness: Very low magic defense, very little armor, slow, uncoordinated. Easy kills, even for beginning adventurers.
fauna.treasure: Food, 1-10 pyreals, or the occasional small weapon. Frequently, nothing. Also drops Drudge Charms and Scarlet Red Letters. Sometimes drops an Academy Stamp or a Peppermint Stick.
fauna.comments: These small, pale Drudges are easy fodder for beginning adventurers. As with all Drudges, they can be lethal to exhausted or inattentive fighters, and they most often operate in groups.
fauna.location: Just about everywhere in eastern Osteth.

fauna.name: Drudge Slinker
fauna.offense: Commonly seen with throwing weapons such as shouken and daggers. Uses hand to hand weapons up to shortsword and yaoji.
fauna.weakness: Very low magic defense, very little armor. Particularly susceptible to Low attacks.
fauna.treasure: Everything from nothing at all through yaoji-valued weapons. Sometimes drops a simi. Also carries off-the-shelf armor and magic components. Occasionally drops a Drudge Charm, Brown Beans, Peppermint Stick or a Scarlet Red Letter. Sometimes drops an Academy Stamp.
fauna.comments: Don't let the size deceive you. These Drudges are as big as Skulkers, but their yellowish color belies their true strength. They like to group with Prowlers to add their ranged attack to the fray.
fauna.location: Just about everywhere in eastern Osteth

fauna.name: Drudge Sneaker
fauna.offense: Slashing and piercing hand weapons from knives to short swords and yaoji. Sometimes uses hand axes and shou-ono, and has been known to use shouken and throwing daggers.
fauna.weakness: Very low magic defense, very little armor. Particularly susceptible to Low attacks.
fauna.treasure: Everything from nothing at all through yaoji-valued weapons. Also carries off-the-shelf armor and magic components. Occasionally drops a Drudge Charms, Brown Beans, A Lucky Gold Letter, Peppermint Stick or Brown Beans. Sometimes drops an Academy Stamp.
fauna.comments: These Drudges are the same size as Prowlers, but aren`t as tough in hand to hand as Slinkers. Their coloration is a cross between the Slinker and Prowler as well. The way they fight, they really should be level 3.
fauna.location: Just about everywhere in eastern Osteth

fauna.name: Drudge Prowler
fauna.offense: Slashing and piercing hand weapons from knives to short swords and yaoji. Sometimes uses hand axes and shou-ono, and has been known to use shouken and throwing daggers. Deceptively powerful attacks.
fauna.weakness: Very low magic defense, very little armor. Particularly susceptible to Low attacks.
fauna.treasure: Everything from nothing at all through yaoji-valued weapons. Sometimes drops a simi. Also carries off-the-shelf armor and magic components. They also commonly drop a Drudge Charm, Brown Beans, A Scarlet Red Letter, or A Lucky Gold Letter. Sometimes drops a Drudge Head or a Peppermint Stick. Sometimes drops an Academy Stamp.
fauna.comments: Tougher than it would first appear, and rarely appearing alone, a pair or trio of Prowlers can make short work of a lone adventurer below 5th level.Submitted by Quendor and Maddy.
fauna.location: Just about everywhere in eastern Osteth

fauna.name: Drudge Robber
fauna.offense: Slashing and piercing hand weapons from knives to short swords and yaoji. Sometimes uses hand axes and shou-ono, and has been known to use shouken and throwing daggers. Also fights unarmed. Deceptively powerful attacks.
fauna.weakness: Very low magic defense, very little armor. Particularly susceptible to Low attacks.
fauna.treasure: Rarely drops "normal drudge" items. Items that have been found on Robbers in the past include mana stones; magic jewelry, gems, armor, and weapons; high-quality high-AL armor; "other metal" weapons such as bronze and copper swords. Sometimes drops a Peppermint Stick or A Lucky Gold Letter or Brown Beans.
fauna.comments: These Drudges have fixed spawn points, so if you find one, it will always appear in that same spot. A rare breed of Drudge, but extremely valuable to the starting adventurer. Don't tell anyone where you find one, if you do.

fauna.name: Drudge Servant
fauna.comments: Thanks to Phergus for stats and picture submissions. Formerly called Drudge Slave (high), changed for A New Threat.

fauna.name: Drudge Vagabond
fauna.treasure: A Lucky Gold Letter
fauna.comments: Thanks to John Carroll for stats and screenshot. Creature introduced in the Sept 2001 patch.

fauna.name: Drudge Slave
fauna.comments: Usually found near higher level creatures such as Tumeroks. Also found in a lvl 8 variety with 45 strength, 60 endurance, 110 coordination, and 60 health. Thanks to Sauron`s Bane for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: Drudge Robber Baron
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a
fauna.comments: Thank you Balthazar!

fauna.name: Drudge Lurker
fauna.offense: Typically hand to hand combat. Some offensive spell casting.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Ruined Amulet of the Atlatl or Brown Beans.
fauna.comments: Dusty grey coloring, the Direland Drudge that most looks like it's Osteth cousins. Be wary of nearby drudges coming to its aid. Submitted by Uzi-El and Quendor

fauna.name: Drudge Stalker
fauna.offense: Any kind of hand weapon can be found on these, as well as most thrown projectiles. Commonly found using fists and feet.
fauna.weakness: Use fire. And, they are drudges...
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Ruined Amulet of the Sword or Brown Beans.
fauna.comments: Even though they're 3 levels lower than Raveners, these Drudges make up in strength what they lack in speed... and they don't lack for speed. The same tips apply as for Raveners, but make sure you start with 150 stamina.

fauna.name: Northern Black Claw Raider
fauna.offense: Much like Drudge Stalkers, the real threat are the war spells.
fauna.comments: Introduced in the June 2001 patch. Thanks to Veritus Venatus for the stats.Submitted by Futility and Quendor.

fauna.name: Southern Black Claw Raider
fauna.offense: Does not hesitate to start chain casting war spells. They can add up quickly and surprise any adventurer. Whirling Blade and Force Bolt seem to be its favorites.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops Brown Beans.
fauna.comments: Added in the June 2001 patch.Submitted by Quendor.

fauna.name: Drudge Ravener
fauna.offense: Any kind of hand weapon can be found on these, as well as most thrown projectiles. Commonly found using fists and feet.
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops Ravener Guts or a Ruined Amulet of the Mace or Brown Beans. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Bigger than Prowlers and a dusky grey, these Drudges are blindingly fast, tenacious, and magic resistant. Make sure you go into combat with them with at least 120 stamina; the speed of their attacks wears a lone fighter down in no time.

fauna.name: Northern Black Claw Leader
fauna.offense: Will cast level 3 debuffs, and level 4 war spells (mostly Bludge, pierce and blade IV).
fauna.treasure: Drops the Northern Quiddity Fragment.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Optim shi for all information (and pic). Submitted by Futility and Quendor.

fauna.name: Southern Black Claw Leader
fauna.offense: Will cast level 3 debuffs, and level 4 war spells (mostly Bludge, pierce and blade IV).
fauna.treasure: Drops the Southern Quiddity Fragment.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Optim shi for all information (and pic).Submitted by Quendor.

fauna.name: Baktak the Human Slayer
fauna.comments: One of the two boss drudges that drops the Champion Belt. Thanks Zaerik.

fauna.name: Altered Drudge
fauna.offense: Debuffs its targets and uses VERY aggressive life magic. And hits really really hard anyway. Occassionally throws a Lightning Bolt, and sometimes throws wicked lightning thrown weapons
fauna.treasure: May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Optim Shi. Graphics upgraded with Throne of Destiny Expansion.

fauna.name: Augmented Drudge
fauna.comments: Thanks to Ana for the picture submission. Submitted by Eoj of Harvestgain and Quendor
fauna.spoiler_general: Uses Fire based weapons.

fauna.name: Banished Drudge
fauna.treasure: Drops Banished Staff

fauna.name: Murk Drudge
fauna.treasure: May drop a Murk Drudge Charm.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Sauces of Frostfell.

fauna.name: Drudge Sage
fauna.treasure: May drop a Sturdy Iron Key or a Drudge Sage Charm.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Arusha and Sauces.

fauna.name: Gloom Drudge
fauna.treasure: May drop a Sturdy Iron Key or a Gloom Drudge Charm.
fauna.comments: Submitted by The Trix Rabbit FF and Mahret of LC.

fauna.name: Drudge Mystic
fauna.treasure: May drop a Sturdy Iron Key or a Drudge Mystic Charm.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Mahret of Leafcull.

fauna.name: Unconquered Drudge
fauna.offense: Uses elemental weapons.
fauna.comments: Very high magic defense can make these hard to kill for mages. Thanks to Mad Prophet for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: Ascendant Drudge
fauna.offense: Can cast level 6 debuffs(weakness/clumsiness/lightning vul/imperil)and does one war spell (lightning Bolt), as well as use varieying elemental weapons. Extremely hard to hit by anyone of any class.
fauna.treasure: May drop a Sturdy Steel Key.
fauna.comments: Creature introduced in the Sept 2001 patch, thanks to Astral Dominae of Thistledown for stats, magic defense submitted by Dar`van al-Zanuf.

fauna.name: Drudge Bloodletter
fauna.offense: Uses a variety of War spells along with vulns & debuffs, also uses various elemental based melee weapons.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops Brown Beans. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key, a Sturdy Steel Key or a Bloodletter Drudge Charm.
fauna.comments: Stats from General Specific of Darktide.Updated stats from Dar.

fauna.name: Peerless Drudge
fauna.offense: Loves to cast Gossamer Flesh (Imperil VII) approach with caution.
fauna.treasure: May drop a Sturdy Iron Key, a Sturdy Steel Key or a Peerless Drudge Charm.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Dark-Maji of Solclaim and Raziel the Cursed.

fauna.name: Drudge Cabalist
fauna.treasure: May drop a Sturdy Iron Key, a Sturdy Steel Key or a Drudge Cabalist Charm.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Mahret of Leafcull and Contazia Olara.

fauna.name: Withered Drudge Seraph
fauna.comments: This creature was introduced during Jan 2005's Assault update, that included an area for hunters without life magic to vuln and imperil.

fauna.name: Withered Drudge Seraph Mystic
fauna.comments: This creature was introduced during Jan 2005's Assault update, that included an area for hunters without life magic to vuln and imperil.

fauna.name: Drudge Seraph
fauna.offense: Lightning Vuln VI & Self Loathing are among their two favorite Spells, as are Lightning VI & VII War Spells. They also use Elemental throwing weapons (usually Frost & Fire)
fauna.weakness: Critical strike piercing and fire dmgs are very effective for melees.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Mangled Dark Key or a Twisted Dark Key.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Thrumm. Thanks to Lion of Darktide for Stats & Weakness.Thanks to Yachi of Wintersebb for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: Eater
fauna.comments: Submitted by Shobuck Jr (Leafcull)

fauna.name: Marauder
fauna.spoiler_general: Submitted by Mr Fizz of LC

fauna.name: Voracious Eater
fauna.comments: Submitted by Shobuck Jr (Leafcull)
fauna.spoiler_general: Anyway, this eater can be found in packs of 3 or 4 when out in the open. Each kill is worth about 52k xp.

fauna.name: Repugnant Eater
fauna.comments: Submitted by Mr Fizz of LC Submitted by Random Magic of LC

fauna.name: Abhorrant Eater
fauna.comments: Submitted by Shobuck Jr (Leafcull) Submitted by Random Magic (Leafcull)
fauna.spoiler_general: Level 135, not all that fast running at you. It does pierce, slash and acid damage.

fauna.name: Ravenous Eater
fauna.comments: Submitted by Eoj of HG Submitted by Random Magic LC

fauna.name: Insatiable Eater
fauna.comments: Submitted by Eoj of HG Submitted by Random Magic of LC.
fauna.spoiler_general: Slashing works well vs. Eaters Found in Insatiable Vault (97.4N, 48.0W)

fauna.name: Bloated Eater
fauna.offense: Splits acid
fauna.treasure: Lillies
fauna.comments: Submitted by Shobuck Jr (Leafcull) Submitted update by Random Magic of LC.

fauna.name: Theral
fauna.offense: Fire/Frost War/Life Magic Spells & Ring Spells & Fire/Frost Melee Dmg.
fauna.weakness: While Lightning works well The New Isparian Shimmering Weapons are the best attack.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops Pyreal/Gold Peas (they fall on the ground since no corpse is left).
fauna.comments: One of the "dual" Elementals.Submitted by Quendor.

fauna.name: Sirrocco
fauna.offense: Fire/Frost War/Life & Ring Spells & Melee Attacks
fauna.weakness: While vulnerable to Lightning Dmg, usually their first spell is a buff against Lightning dmg. The best attack is one of the new Shimmering Isparian Weapons.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drop Pyreal and Gold Peas (they fall one the grond since there is no corpse)
fauna.comments: These are Dual-Elementals, of the Fire / Frost kind. Introduced in the May 2002 patch. Thanks to CRuD for correct category.Submitted by Quendor.

fauna.name: Hand of Enchantment
fauna.comments: Submitted by Random Magic of LC

fauna.name: Tsuric
fauna.offense: Lightning/Acid War Magic and Vulns & Ring Spells
fauna.weakness: While being vulnerable to Frost the best attack is one of the new Shimmering Isparian Weapons.
fauna.comments: These are Dual-Elementals, of the lightning and Acid kind. Thanks to CRuD for correct category.

fauna.name: Scoriscant
fauna.comments: This is a Dual Elemental of the Fire / Acid kind. They cast VII war bolts, so tread lightly! Thanks to Bad Ben for stats.

fauna.name: Glacial Knight
fauna.offense: Glacial Knight cast Gelidite's Gift on you, surpassing Gelidite's Gift, Glacial Knight cast Gossamer Flesh on you
fauna.comments: Submitted by Random Magic of LC.

fauna.name: Blizzard
fauna.comments: This is a Dual-Elemental of the Lightning / Frost kind. Thanks to Bad Ben for stats.

fauna.name: Conflagration
fauna.comments: This is a dual elemental of the Fire / Acid kind.

fauna.name: Avalanche
fauna.comments: This is a Dual Elemental, of the Lightning / Frost kind.

fauna.name: Flame Guardian
fauna.comments: Submitted by Mr Fizz of LC

fauna.name: Water Guardian
fauna.comments: Submitted by Mr Fizz of LC

fauna.name: Harbinger
fauna.comments: More Details to come hopefully. Thanks to Spacelord of Leafcull for the picture submission.

fauna.name: Asheron (updated version)
fauna.comments: Thank you to Zeddmon of Wintersebb for Stats submission, and Thank you Ancient Wizard of Frostfell for the Pic.

fauna.name: Gaerlan (+Admin Controlled)
fauna.offense: Devestating Elemental Magic that can wipe out entire groups of players and Creature spells that can reduce Stats to nothing.Master of Elemental magic. Has a SERIOUS grudge against Asheron.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Rowland for Stats and Pic

fauna.name: Asheron
fauna.comments: Pic and stats thanks to Wizard Macleods of Thisledown.

fauna.name: Gaerlan
fauna.offense: Impervious to elemental attacks. His hands do elemental melee damg.
fauna.weakness: Weak to any non elemental attacks. Slashing seems the best overal.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Krell of Leafcull for the awsome picture!

fauna.name: Flicker
fauna.offense: Small amounts of heat damage and the occasional Flame Bolt I
fauna.treasure: usually a couple spell components, a gem, and a piece of jewelry.
fauna.comments: These appear to be mostly passive but will quickly come to the defense of another fire elemental that is under attack.

fauna.name: Flare
fauna.offense: unknown
fauna.treasure: unknown
fauna.comments: Looks somewhat like a flaming person. Very fast.Submitted by Quendor.

fauna.name: Gout
fauna.offense: Fire War Magic/Life Magic Self Buffing/Draining
fauna.comments: Submitted by Osis.

fauna.name: Flamma
fauna.offense: Flame Bolts III and IV. Also does a fair amount of heat damage. Moves very quickly and can summon flares and flickers to aid itself in combat.
fauna.treasure: unknown
fauna.comments: Approach with caution. Because of this creatures extreme speed, others may rush to its defense, overwelming you before you realize it.

fauna.name: Ember
fauna.comments: Thanks to Tymar for Magic Defense.Submitted by Quendo.

fauna.name: Mount Lethe Hellfire
fauna.treasure: Carries Blue Fire Infusion

fauna.name: Inferno
fauna.offense: These guys mean business. Level 6 spells, massive fire damage from physical attacks.
fauna.treasure: Balls of Fire currently. Items that look like throwing daggers in inventory, but do 6-8 fire damage. Interesting items.
fauna.comments: The new AI scripting for these creatures makes them very formidable for even high level mages. They follow Cold Vulnerability with Cold Protection, they debuff opponents... Good Luck!
fauna.location: In dungeons in the depths of Dereth

fauna.name: Firestorm
fauna.comments: Thanks to Khaine LC for stats!Submitted by Quendor.

fauna.name: Hellfire
fauna.offense: Will throw balls of fire to start, or will even go hand to hand. Will debuff without hesitating, and will cast up to level 6 war spells at you.
fauna.weakness: Chill it, and it might slow down.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Khaine LC for stats! Submitted by Chillz of WE.

fauna.name: Strife (Retired)
fauna.offense: Level VII Spells in all Schools. Fire based War Attacks and Melee.
fauna.treasure: None
fauna.comments:
The Essensce of Fire Incarnate.
Thank you to Beefus of Leafcull for pic and stats!

fauna.name: Maddened Fiun
fauna.comments: Introduced during Throne of Destiny Preview. Submitted by Mr Fizz of LC.

fauna.name: Crazed Fiun
fauna.comments: This creature was introduced during the Throne of Destiny Preview. Submitted by Mr Fizz of LC

fauna.name: Raving Fiun
fauna.comments: Submitted by Mr Fizz

fauna.name: Demented Fiun
fauna.comments: Discovered during Throne of Destiny Preview. Submitted by Mr Fizz of LC.

fauna.name: Deranged Fiun
fauna.comments: Submitted by Shobuck Jr (Leafcull)

fauna.name: Frenzied Fiun
fauna.treasure: Red Garnet, Black Garnet, Steel
fauna.comments: Discovered during Throne of Destiny Preview. Submitted by Mr Fizz of LC Thanks to Randommagic for fire/light info.
fauna.spoiler_general: Found in abayar's laboratory

fauna.name: Maniacal Fiun
fauna.comments: Submitted by Mr Fizz of LC

fauna.name: Crystal Shard Sentinel
fauna.treasure: May drop a Small Shard.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Zen Tek Ken for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: Fenmalain Satellite Fragment
fauna.offense: Not a big threat, but there can be alot of them together.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Topheron for stats.

fauna.name: Broken Fragment
fauna.offense: Lots of level II war spells and vulnerabilites.
fauna.weakness: Physical attacks seem to have more of an effect than elemental.
fauna.treasure: Spell components mostly, small gems. On rare occasions they will drop a Cracked Shard. Sometimes drops a Shard of the Herald Stamp.
fauna.comments: Extremely high magic resistance. Fairly high Melee and Missile defenses. These creatures regenerate *very* fast, and heal themselves often.Submitted by Bones the Huntsman.
fauna.location: All over Osteth, during the Dark Thaw
fauna.spoiler_general: -Bats

fauna.name: Caulnalain Satellite Fragment
fauna.comments: Thanks to Topheron for stats.

fauna.name: Fragment
fauna.offense: Level III and occasional IV war magic and vulnerabilities.
fauna.weakness: Bludgeoning and piercing seem most effective so far. Attack mid level. They do have low health, so once you do connect, they don't last long.
fauna.treasure: Mostly spell components and gems. About 1 in every 50 to 100 fragments will carry a Tiny Shard. Sometimes drops a Shard of the Herald Stamp.
fauna.comments: Extremely high magic resistance. Fairly high Melee and Missile defenses. These creatures regenerate *very* fast, and heal themselves often.Submitted by Alextium of WE and Quendor. XP updated by Briciu
fauna.location: All over Osteth, during the Dark Thaw
fauna.spoiler_general: -Bats

fauna.name: Shendolain Satellite Fragment
fauna.comments: Thanks to Jaguar for Stats.Thanks to Axey of Leafcull for picture.

fauna.name: Nexus Fragment
fauna.offense: Fire Spells,Harms & Drains as well as Slowness.
fauna.treasure: Small Shard
fauna.comments: Thanks to Redfeather of Wintersebb for submitting this creature.

fauna.name: Sentient Fragment
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Small Shard or a Crystal Sword.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Quendor.

fauna.name: Dual Fragment
fauna.offense: lvl 4/5 creature/life/war spells Possible Melee Defense: 420 Possible Attack Skill: 337 Possible Deception Skill: 193
fauna.weakness: lightning/bludge/piercing attacks seem to work best Easily one shot with a pierce rending bow and deadly pierce arrows.
fauna.treasure: On rare occasions they will drop a Small Shard. Sometimes drops a Shard of the Herald Stamp.
fauna.comments: These creatures are are no longer non-aggressive. They often unload a number of inteptitude spells on their target, followed by lots of big spells. Submitted by Roberto the First and Quendor. XP updated by Briciu.

fauna.name: Crystal Fragment
fauna.offense: Does LOTS of level V debuff spells.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Tien Lung of LC, Lin De-Bain, Zarnon of TD, Trai and Genghis Khan (HG).

fauna.name: Crystal Shard
fauna.offense: Possible Attack Skill: 410
fauna.treasure: May drop a Small Shard.

fauna.name: Crystal Moiety
fauna.offense: Does Level VII Spells including Arcs.
fauna.weakness: Use physical attacks over elemental ones.
fauna.treasure: May drop a Small Shard.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Uriel Al-Arqas of Leafcull for Magic Defense & Exp Value. Thanks to Servian for Stats.

fauna.name: Fenmalain Crystal
fauna.offense: Moves slow, but can hit HARD. Watch out for the occasional blast of lightning too.
fauna.treasure: Drops the Fenmalain Gem.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Topheron for stats.

fauna.name: Caulnalain Crystal
fauna.offense: Hits very hard for bludgeoning damage, and shoots high level war spells.
fauna.treasure: Drops the Caulnalain Gem.
fauna.comments: Thanks to topheron for stats, and to Kinrowan for magic Defense.

fauna.name: Shendolain Crystal
fauna.offense: Hits extremely hard with bludgeoning melee attack, and shoots level VI war spells. Not to be dealt with lightly.
fauna.treasure: Drops the Shendolain Gem.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Topheron and Jaguar for stats.

fauna.name: Sentient Crystal Shard
fauna.comments: Submitted by Aargau of Darktide.Thanks to Yachi of Wintersebb for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: Flake
fauna.comments: You leave them alone they leave you alone.=)

fauna.name: Chill
fauna.offense: Frost War Magic/Life Magic Self Buffing/Draining

fauna.name: Horripal
fauna.comments: Thanks to Jaz for the creature stats.Thanks to Zen Tek Ken for Magic Defense.
fauna.location: Random spawns sighted in northern Osteth

fauna.name: Shivver
fauna.comments: New creature for the feb 2002 patch. Thanks to Seraquiel for stats.

fauna.name: Frost
fauna.comments: New creature from the feb 2002 patch. Thanks to Dostovic of Harvestgain for stats! XP updated by Briciu.

fauna.name: Brumal
fauna.comments: Thanks to Seraquiel for stats.

fauna.name: Hyem
fauna.comments: Thanks to Seraquiel for stats.

fauna.name: Gelid
fauna.comments: Thanks to Jaz for the creature stats.Thanks to Zen Tek Ken for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: Stasis (Retired)
fauna.offense: Level VII Spells in all Schools.Cold based War Attacks and Melee.
fauna.comments:
The Essensce of Frost Incarnate.
Thanks again to Beefus of Leafcull for the submission!

fauna.name: Gelidite Initiate
fauna.comments: Thanks to Quendor.

fauna.name: Gelidite Acolyte
fauna.comments: Thanks to Quendor

fauna.name: Gelidite Lord
fauna.comments: Thanks to Quendor.

fauna.name: Sir Joffre Tremblant
fauna.offense: Melee
fauna.treasure: Carries a book
fauna.comments: Once the finest Staff warrior of Arwic who perished in his quest to the lost city of Frore. Tremblant has been damned to never reappear at any lifestone but to serve as a Revenant.

fauna.name: Frisirth
fauna.offense: Melee
fauna.treasure: An Old Book
fauna.comments: The Gelidite Acolyte who discovered the Great Work and attempted to bend it to the Gelidite's own purpose

fauna.name: Specter
fauna.comments: Thanks to Ra Rai for the pic!

fauna.name: Phantom
fauna.comments: Screenshot and level submitted by Harrower Grievver of Frostfell.

fauna.name: Haunt
fauna.comments: Screenshot and level submitted by Harrower Grievver of Frostfell.

fauna.name: Poltergeist
fauna.comments: Screenshot and level submitted by Harrower Grievver of Frostfell.

fauna.name: Iron Golem Guardian
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Pyreal Mote.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Astalon Decuth of WE.
fauna.location: Spear of the Given Heart Quest

fauna.name: Guardian Golem
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Diamond Heart.

fauna.name: Sparring Golem
fauna.offense: Will only attack if attacked.
fauna.comments: Introduced in the dec 2001 patch, used to teach new players attack skills. Will drop Academy Token on first death. Thanks to Seraquiel for stats.

fauna.name: Mud Golem
fauna.offense: Bludgeoning swing and stomp attacks, II-level war magic.
fauna.weakness: Bludgeoning damage and spells (Shockwave, Force Bolt), though their magic resistance is high. Fire is also marginally better against these creatures.
fauna.treasure: Magic components, non-magic jewelry, the occasional magic gem. Sometimes drops a Pyreal Mote, Mud Golem Heart or Muddy Towel.
fauna.comments: Will attack with ranged spells without charging, especially when you're fighting another one of its kind at a distance. Keep an eye on any motionless Mud Golems while you're fighting for incoming spells.

fauna.name: Water Golem
fauna.offense: Bludgeoning swing and stomp attacks, II and III-level war magic.
fauna.weakness: Cold or fire weapons and spells, bludgeoning damage and spells (Shockwave, Force Bolt), though their magic resistance is high.
fauna.treasure: Magic components, non-magic jewelry, the occasional magic gem or Pyreal Mote. Sometimes drops a Water Golem Heart or a Wet Towel.
fauna.comments: Will attack with ranged spells without charging, especially when you're fighting another one of its kind at a distance. Keep an eye on any motionless Water Golems while you're fighting for incoming spells.
fauna.location: In and beside bodies of water

fauna.name: Zirconium Golem
fauna.offense: Unsure, this golem is a very low level in a very high level dungeon. It doesn't live long enough to cast too many spells.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Pyreal Mote.
fauna.comments: Very easy creature. Looks like a diamond golem, moves like a diamond golem, smells like a diamond golem... but isn't a diamond golem. No harder than a mud golem.

fauna.name: Tainted golem
fauna.weakness: A well placed hit with a mace will help you out here.
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops a Pyreal Mote.
fauna.comments: These were creatures tainted by the bloody waters of "The Child of Daralet" Event. They dissapeared with the defeat of Bael'Zharon.

fauna.name: Wood Golem
fauna.offense: Throw level II war magic. They move very slowly, so escaping them is easy unless you forget to dodge.
fauna.weakness: Fire and blunt attacks are very effective.
fauna.treasure: Mainly gems and spell components. Occasionly you may also find a Wood Heart, which can be turned in to Stone Collectors and Trophy Crafter. But this happens maybe once in every 20-30 golems. Occasionally drops a Pyreal Mote. Occasionally drops a Fletching Stamp.
fauna.comments: Like most golems, fighting these brusiers strictly with ranged attacks is particularly affective because of their slow speed.

fauna.name: Limestone Golem
fauna.offense: They hit hard for bludgeoning damage and throw some war magic. They seem mostly fond of whirling blade and Shock Wave sticking to level I and II spells. They can also occasionally use creature magic favoring Vulnerability and Clumsiness
fauna.weakness: Bludgeoning is very effective against them, and they have no appreciable magic resistance. They are also fairly slow and with a ranged attack suseptable to hit and run tactics.
fauna.treasure: Gems and magical jewelry along with spell components (usually powders). Occasionally drop a Pyreal Mote.
fauna.comments: If you can keep these guys at a range, they are fairly easy for their level. Just be warry of letting them get a melee attack on you as their strength will cause a great deal of damage. Be well armored before going hand to hand with them.

fauna.name: Ice Golem
fauna.offense: Bludgeoning swing and stomp attacks, II and III-level war magic.
fauna.weakness: Flame weapons and spells, bludgeoning damage and spells (Shockwave, Force Bolt, Flame Blast), though their magic resistance is high.
fauna.treasure: Magic components, non-magic and magical jewelry, the occasional magic gem and Pyreal Mote.
fauna.comments: Will attack with ranged spells without charging, especially when you're fighting another one of its kind at a distance. Keep an eye on any motionless Ice Golems while you're fighting for incoming spells.

fauna.name: Forest Lord
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Wood Heart or a Pyreal Mote.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Circeus / Amid for info. Thanks to Seraquiel for stats.

fauna.name: Sandstone Golem
fauna.offense: Melee and Magic
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops a Pyreal Mote.

fauna.name: Elaniwood Golem
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Elaniwood Golem Heart. Occasionally drops a Fletching Stamp or a Pyreal Mote.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Meglo the Maniac of WE for stats and pic.Updated info submitted by Roberto the First.

fauna.name: Mud Golem Sludge Lord
fauna.comments: Thanks Saurok. Pic thanks to Mortal Coil of Solclaim.

fauna.name: Sand Golem
fauna.treasure: Occasionaly drops a Pyreal Mote or Sand Golem Heart.
fauna.comments: Thanks to R. Hackett for stats. Thanks to Roberto the First for the image.

fauna.name: Granite Golem
fauna.offense: Bludgeoning swing and stomp attacks, III-level war magic.
fauna.weakness: Bludgeoning damage and spells (Shockwave, Force Bolt), though their magic resistance is high.
fauna.treasure: Mostly gems, sometimes enchanted jewelry. Granite Heart, which may be turned in to Stone Collectors and Stone Craftsmen. Also drops Pyreal Mote.
fauna.comments: Updated info from Alextium of WE, Uzi-El and Quendor.

fauna.name: Iron Golem
fauna.offense: They hit hard, and throw level IV war magic.
fauna.weakness: Extremely vulnerable to Acid and Electrical attacks. Blunt is about the only physical attack worth trying.
fauna.treasure: Gems, and occasionaly jewelry. Iron Heart which can be turned in at Stone Collectors or Stone Craftsmen. Can also drop a Pyreal Mote.
fauna.comments: Updated info from Alextium of WE, Uzi-El. XP updated by Briciu.

fauna.name: Iron Golem Kingpin
fauna.comments: Iron Golem Boss. Thanks Saurok.

fauna.name: Copper Golem
fauna.offense: Lightning War Spells
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops a Pyreal Mote or Copper Heart.
fauna.comments: Updated info submitted by Uzi-El.

fauna.name: Damaged Glacial Golem
fauna.comments: Submitted by Druideth of TD

fauna.name: Tenuous Nephol Golem
fauna.treasure: Small Pale Crystal. Sunstone Geode.
fauna.comments: This is the first level golem in the trials for the Hieromancer's Armor. Stats thanks to Danier. Thanks to Redwan for Magic Defense.
fauna.location: Found in the Exarc Plate Armor quest

fauna.name: Scold Lump
fauna.comments: After you kill a Scold Chunk 2 or more even smaller version of scold spawn called "Scold Lump" Submitted by Zen Tek Ken and Yun-Fat of TD

fauna.name: Silencia's Magma Golem (Motey)
fauna.offense: Well, she stands there...
fauna.weakness: For a while, you could target her with a 'tested spell', but that's been fixed, thankfully
fauna.treasure: NONE! Don't Kill Her!
fauna.comments: This creature is well versed in the craft of creating Atlan Weapons from infused ingots of pyreal.
fauna.spoiler_general: What did you expect to see here?

fauna.name: Repair Golem (NPC)
fauna.comments: Part of the Aerlinthe Quest.

fauna.name: Smithing Golem (NPC)
fauna.comments: Part of the Aerlinthe Quest.

fauna.name: Oubliette Gatekeeper (NPC)
fauna.comments: Part of the Nuhmudira's Boon Quest. Thanx Uzi-El for the pic!

fauna.name: Glacial Golem
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Pyreal Mote.
fauna.comments: New Creature from the february 2002 patch. Level upgraded September 2004

fauna.name: Unstable Magma Golem
fauna.offense: They explode when they die. Damaging all around them.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Black Rock or a Pyreal Mote.

fauna.name: Obsidian Golem
fauna.offense: Possible Attack Skill: 200
fauna.weakness: Truely obscene magic resistance. Mages should stay well clear of these, but a blund wielding warrior won't have too many problems. Possible Melee Defense: 381 Possible Melee Defense: 331 Possible Melee Defense: 267
fauna.treasure: Know to occasionally yield a Black Stone that is treasure by many gem colletors. Frequently drops a Pyreal Mote. Sometimes drops a Obsidian Heart. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.

fauna.name: Obsidian Excavation Golem
fauna.offense: Possible Attack Skill: 200
fauna.weakness: Possible Melee Defense: 331 Possible Melee Defense: 265
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Black Stone or an Obsidian Heart or a Pyreal Mote.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Seraquiel

fauna.name: Diaphanous Nephol Golem
fauna.treasure: Drops a Pale Crystal. Sunstone Geode.
fauna.comments: Info thanks to Kyle the Red Wizard and Danier

fauna.name: Scold Chunk
fauna.comments: Submitted by Zen Tek Ken and Yun-Fat of TD
fauna.spoiler_general: Scold Chunk is one that leaves a corpse and also drops the Scold's Heart. Which is used at the nearby Snowman Village.

fauna.name: Unstable Glacial Golem
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Pyreal Mote.
fauna.comments: New Creature from the Feb 2002 patch. Thanks to Dostovic of Harvestgain for stats!

fauna.name: Glacial Golem Margrave
fauna.treasure: Pyreal Nugget sometimes
fauna.comments: Thanks to Freep of Leafcull for the stats.Updated stats submitted by Dotcher, Trai and Shevek.

fauna.name: Oak Golem
fauna.offense: Is capable of regenerating health extremely quickly.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes you will find a Tree Trunk or a Pyreal Mote in the remains of an Oak Golem. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: New creature for the Feb 2002 patch. Updated info by Quendor.

fauna.name: Mist Golem
fauna.offense: Weak to Frost. These golems are basically "baby" Vapor Golems, sames spells (Weak/Fire Vuln/Imperil/Slowness etc) Possible Attack Skill: 300
fauna.weakness: Possible Melee Defense: 307 Possible Melee Defense: 441
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Pyreal Mote.
fauna.comments: Found in the Annex of the Gift Box Quest Update.
fauna.spoiler_general: Submitted by Clearsky of WE, Thank you to crzy for the Image and Stats.Updated info by Ranador of FF.

fauna.name: Basalt Golem
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops an Obsidian Heart or a Black Stone. Also, Basalt Golems are the sourse of the Basalt Blade. Known to drop Pyreal Nuggets as well. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Volgein of WE for stats and pic.

fauna.name: Nubilous Golem
fauna.offense: These golems are basically "baby" Plasma Golems, sames spells Level lV Vulns & Lighting Bolts. Possible Attack Skill: 348
fauna.weakness: Slightly more vulnerable to Lightning/Acid & Cold (in that order). Possible Melee Defense: 503 Possible Melee Defense: 350
fauna.treasure: May drop a Pyreal Mote. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Found in the Annex of the Gift Box Quest also. Update. Submitted by crzy & Ranador of FF.

fauna.name: Crystal Golem
fauna.comments: Thanks to Seraquiel for stats and pic. Creature added in the March 2002 patch.Updated info from Tosan Empire of LC & Quendor.
fauna.spoiler_general: This creature will rebuff himself after being debuffed.

fauna.name: Scold
fauna.comments: This guy is pretty neat kill him, and then he splits into 4 little golems kill them and they split up into several smaller golems. Submitted by Zen Tek Ken and Yun-Fat of TD

fauna.name: Gold Golem
fauna.offense: Fire spells & vulns mostly.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Pyreal Mote. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Fenn of Darktide for submission.

fauna.name: Mighty Oak Golem
fauna.comments:
Drops the a tree trunk.
Thanks to Cerulia.

fauna.name: Coral Golem
fauna.offense: The easiest of the new SuperGolems. This particular breed does not debuff, and only utilizes Acid based War Magic.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Pyreal Mote or a Coral Heart.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Scared Rabbit and Quendor.

fauna.name: Diamond Golem
fauna.offense: Loves to Cast Bludg Vuln VI & Imperil VI followed by a Shockwave or 2. They also love to cast War/life Magic Ineptitudes as well as Weakness VI.
fauna.weakness: Bludgeoning seems to be the best attack of all.
fauna.treasure: Drops Diamond Powder, Diamond Heart and the occasional Pyreal Mote. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Updated info submitted by Trai and Zycra.

fauna.name: Small Water Golem
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Water Golem Heart or Pyreal Mote or a Wet Towel.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Zen Tek Ken.Thanks to Yachi of Wintersebb for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: Gelidite Golem
fauna.offense: Casts weapon debuffs

fauna.name: Magma Golem Exarch
fauna.treasure: Occasionaly coughs up a Pyreal Nugget. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Circeus of Harvestgain (of ACMonster fame) for stat & Pic submissions. =) Thanks to Michelle the Bruce of Morningthaw for Exp update.Updated level info from Mahret of LC.

fauna.name: Acidic Coral Golem
fauna.offense: Level V Acid War Spells.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Pyreal Mote.
fauna.comments: New creature from the feb 2002 patch. Thanks to Seraquiel for stats and picture.Updated info from Scared Rabbit and Phergus.

fauna.name: Small Sand Golem
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Sand Golem Heart or a Pyreal Mote.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Victor Mage of Battle for the pic!

fauna.name: Magma Golem
fauna.offense: Blows do extremely large amounts of heat damage. Can also cast flame bolts.
fauna.weakness: Known to be highly suseptable to ice and frost damage.
fauna.treasure: The only known source of the Black Rock and an occasional source of a Pyreal Mote. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Only the Extremely brave and experience warrior should try to fight this opponent toe to toe. Submitted by Quendor.

fauna.name: Pyreal Golem
fauna.offense: Casts Life/War & Creature Ineptitude VI as well as Imperil, Bludegeon & Lightning Vulnerabillity VI. Lightning Bolt VI is its only War spell. Liberally uses Drain Mana & Health Level I (yes Level one to conserve Mana he he)
fauna.treasure: May drop a Pyreal Golem Heart or Pyreal Mote (Before the March 2003 patch they dropped Slivers). May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: New creature from feb 2002 patch. Thanks to the lovely Ophelea of Leafcull for the picture.

fauna.name: Small Mud Golem
fauna.treasure: Mud Golem Heart
fauna.comments: Submitted by Zen Tek Ken

fauna.name: Small Coral Golem
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Pyreal Mote or a Coral Heart.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Zen Tek Ken.Thanks to Yachi of Wintersebb for Magic Defense. Thanks to Victor Mage of Battle for the pic!

fauna.name: Acidic Diamond Golem
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Pyreal Mote, Diamond Powder, or Diamond Heart. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: New creature from the feb 2002 patch. Thanks to Seraquiel for stats. Updated info from Phergus.

fauna.name: Great Elariwood Golem
fauna.offense: Possible Attack Skill: 475
fauna.comments: Submitted by Seraquiel and Maddy

fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Vapor Golem Heart or a Pyreal Mote. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: An effort by Turbine to prove that no single player is invincible. We Believe You Now!

fauna.name: Small Granite Golem

fauna.offense: Casts level 6 bolts and streaks, level 5 debuffs.
fauna.treasure: Large Pale Crystal. Sunstone Geode.
fauna.comments: Info thanks to Kyle the Red Wizard and Danier

fauna.name: Platinum Golem
fauna.offense: Beware!! They Cast Tuskers Gift(Bludg Vuln VII) & Swordsmans Gift (Blade Vuln VII) and tend to follow those up with the appropriate War VI Spells. They also cast Vulnerabillity VI.
fauna.treasure: Ocassionaly a Pyreal Sliver or Platinum Golem Heart. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: 75k Experience and if you die or fail to land a spell they will taunt you =)

fauna.name: Small Magma Golem
fauna.comments: Submitted by Zen Tek Ken.Thanks to Yachi of Wintersebb for Magic Defense.

fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Pyreal Nugget or a Diamond Heart. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.

fauna.comments: Submitted by Mr Fizz of LC

fauna.name: Fractured Glacial Golem
fauna.comments: Discovered during Throne of Destiny Preview. Submitted by Mr Fizz of LC. Updated xp by Random Magic of LC.

fauna.name: Crystal Minion
fauna.comments: Spawns along with a Crystal Lord and is unkillable with anything other than Magic. Looks like a Zefif but Id's as a Golem.

fauna.name: Diamond Lord
fauna.offense: One for the rare creatures that cast level 7 spells. Even when protected with the highest level spells, these creatures can kill with one spell. Extremely dangerous.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Pyreal Mote, Diamond Powder or a Diamond Heart. Diamond Lords are also the source of the much sought after Diamond Shield. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Roger Tedder for stats, and Khaine LC for screenshot. Creature introduced in the Sept 2001 patch.
fauna.location: Extremely Rare spawns in the dires

fauna.name: Bound Coral Golem
fauna.offense: Casts Acid War magic.

fauna.name: Small Sandstone Golem
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Pyreal Mote.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Reydien of SC.

fauna.name: Small Golem
fauna.offense: Don't be fooled by their size. These knee high terrors are just as capable as full sized Diamond Golems. They cast Techtonic Rifts upon death as well. Almost always come in a 6 pack
fauna.treasure: 100% drop rate on a Diamond Heart, a Pyreal Mote & a Sturdy Iron Key.

fauna.name: Eaushi the Trainer (NPC)
fauna.comments: Part of the Mage Armour Quest.

fauna.name: Diamond Golem Suzerain (Gaerlan Quest)
fauna.comments: Opens a portal to Gaerlans Citadel upon death as well as closes the portal into his lair. Thanks Kash X for the Exp update.

fauna.name: Causeway Sentinal
fauna.comments: Submitted by Mr Fizz of LC

fauna.name: Crystal Lord
fauna.comments: This creature is one of the hardest to kill in Dereth. Not only does it have 25000 health, it also has a host of guards called Crystal Minions! Thanks to Admon Faye of Morningthaw for stats and pic.

fauna.name: Behemoth of Tenkarrdun
fauna.offense: Well, if you stumble onto this guy, you probably know what to expect.
fauna.treasure: The Black Boulder that, when given to a stone collector, becomes an Atlan Stone of Black Fire. The Atlan Stone can be used to give new properties to your atlan weapons.
fauna.spoiler_general: This beast does not spawn until the first phase of the Aerlinthe Island quest is completed.

fauna.name: Crystal Lord Sovereign
fauna.weakness: Not Very Good Defenses against Melee/Missile or Magic but a LOT of HP.
fauna.treasure: Singularity Quality Loot *Note* The Golem leaves no corpse so be ready to grab all the traesure that falls on the ground =)
fauna.comments: Golem was part of Town "Raids" during the July and August 2002 Montly Events. Thanks to Lion-O from DarkTide for picture submission.

fauna.name: Platinum Golem (NPC)
fauna.comments: Found at the end of the Ziggurat Dungeons Give Him the Imbued Pyreal Nugget that was given to you by Asheron and he will open a portal to the Proving Grounds.

fauna.name: Diamond Guardian (NPC) -Old
fauna.comments: You must answer a riddle to gain access past 3 of these Golems.

fauna.name: Asheron's Platinum Golem (NPC)
fauna.comments: Thanks to Uzi-El for pic and stats.

fauna.name: Platinum Golem Mountain King
fauna.comments: Appears with several Platinum Golem "helpers" Thanks to Kailyn of LC for the info.Thanks to Yachi of Wintersebb for Magic Defense.

fauna.comments: Part of the Level 70+ "Decanter" Quest. Thank You to Myuki Santoshi/Okura Santoshi of Morningthaw for Monster Submission and Magic Defense.

fauna.name: Gotrok Titan
fauna.weakness: Lightning and Acid are your best attacks.
fauna.treasure: Drops Singularity Quality loot. Lots of WS(9) Items.

fauna.name: Scuttling Grievver
fauna.offense: None
fauna.comments: A cute little baby Grievver Id's as an item not a monster.

fauna.name: Tunnelling Grievver
fauna.comments: Thanks to Jaz for the creature stats.

fauna.name: Scrawed Grievver
fauna.offense: Acid & Lightning Attacks. Stat debuffing Creature Spells & Harms/Drains
fauna.weakness: Like their Shadow Masters they will assist any Shadows in the area and visa versa.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Ruined Amulet of the Crossbow.
fauna.comments: These creatures are extremely resistance to life magic.

fauna.name: Virulent Grievver
fauna.offense: Lightning Breath & Acid War Spells also does Stat de-buffing spells (weakness, frailty etc.)
fauna.weakness: Slashing and bludgeoning are very effective,Like their Shadow Masters they will assist any Shadows in the area and visa versa.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Vial of Organic Acid or a Ruined Amulet of the Dagger. May also drop a Grievver Tibia.

fauna.name: Venomous Grievver
fauna.offense: Acid Breath & War magic as well as stat bebuffs and harms/drains.
fauna.treasure: Shendolain Key & Occasionaly a "Vial of Organic Acid"
fauna.comments: These creatures are extremely resistance to life magic.

fauna.name: Spinning Grievver
fauna.offense: Lightning & Acid Melee breathe/War Magic attacks as well as Creature magic stat debuffing spells & Life Magic drains.
fauna.weakness: Slashing and bludgeoning are very effective.
fauna.treasure: Silk used to make a Flag.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Jaz for the creature stats.

fauna.name: Banished Grievver
fauna.treasure: Drops Banished Atlatl
fauna.location: Near Danby's Outpost or S. Landbridge

fauna.name: Roufous Grievver
fauna.comments: Thank you Flandango of FF!

fauna.name: Destroyer Grievver
fauna.offense: Lightning Breathe Attacks (Melee) This is by far the most "magic happy" of the Grievvers. Will do War spells (Lightning) Life Harms/drains, Creature Spells (bafflement & weakness). has a high macic resistance approach with caution.
fauna.weakness: Slashing and bludgeoning are very effective,Like their Shadow Masters they will assist any Shadows in the area and visa versa.
fauna.treasure: Bael'Zharon Stamp. Shendolain Key. It should be noted this is the only Grievver that does NOT drop Organic Acid.

fauna.name: Harrower Grievver
fauna.offense: Attacks using Acid Breath(Melee) as well as Acid War Spells also casts Stat debuffing Creature Spells (such as Bafflement).
fauna.weakness: Slashing and bludgeoning are very effective,Like their Shadow Masters they will assist any Shadows in the area and visa versa.
fauna.treasure: Vial of Organic Acid Shendolain Key

fauna.name: Burrowing Grievver
fauna.comments: Submitted by Druideth of LC

fauna.name: Bane Grievver
fauna.offense: Very hard hitting acid and piercing attack.Chain casts Life/War(Level V/VI) /Creature Like there is no tomorrow.
fauna.treasure: Bael'Zharon Stamp, Vial of Organic Acid & Shendolain Key.
fauna.comments: Hard Hitting, chain casting nastyness. Magic Defense from Ranger Bob / Milo Bloom.

fauna.name: Bile Grievver
fauna.offense: The usual Grievver Spells, Creature Debuffs (Weakness, Feeblemind, Bafflement)and an occcasional War Bolt as wee as Lightning/Acid Melee Breath attack.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Mangled Dark Key, Twisted Dark Key or a Vial of Organic Acid.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Ravena. Found by Archmage Zalante and The Last Mage. Stats and Image from Merak. Thanks to Death the Lost Soldier for updated pic.Thanks to Yachi of Wintersebb for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: Rust Gromnie
fauna.offense: Piercing damage bite, frost-based breath weapon.
fauna.treasure: Occasional Thin Gromnie Hide, magic components, pyreals, (rare) non-magic weapons and armor. Food.
fauna.comments: Beware their breath attack. Their level does not adequately reflect the severity of their breath weapon. In addition, the breath weapon can be devastating from behind, so watch your back.

fauna.name: Azure Gromnie
fauna.offense: Piercing damage bite, acid-based breath weapon.
fauna.treasure: Occasional drops Thin Gromnie Hide. Magic components, pyreals, (rare) non-magic weapons and armor. Food.
fauna.comments: Beware their breath attack. Their level does not adequately reflect the severity of their breath weapon. In addition, the breath weapon can be devastating from behind, so watch your back.

fauna.name: Ivory Gromnie
fauna.offense: Piercing damage bite, Fire Elemental Breath Weapon
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops Gromnie Hide () or Ivory Gromnie Tooth. Sometimes a Hot Pepper.
fauna.comments: Beware their breath attack. Their level does not adequately reflect the severity of their breath weapon. In addition, the breath weapon can be devastating from behind, so watch your back.

fauna.name: Jade Gromnie
fauna.offense: Melee, Lightning Elemental Breath
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops a Gromnie Hide () or Jade Gromnie Tooth.

fauna.name: Swamp Gromnie
fauna.offense: Melee, Acid Elemental Breath
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops Gromnie Hide () or Swamp Gromnie Tooth.

fauna.name: Ash Gromnie
fauna.offense: Piercing damage bite, breath weapon. Extremely Fast.
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops Thick Gromnie Hide or Ash Gromnie Tooth, magic components, pyreals, magic and non-magic weapons and armor, magic and non-magic jewelry and gems.
fauna.comments:
Beware their breath attack, it can be devastating from behind, so watch your back. Thanks to Phergus for updated level (02/2003)

There is a static spawn of three Ash Gromnies outside the Shoyanen's Master Mage shop outside Moyoi (63.6S, 86.4E)
