fauna.name: Hea Riketura the Collector (NPC)
fauna.comments: Thanks Uzi-El for the pic and stats.

fauna.name: Hea Mutuona (NPC)
fauna.comments: Thanks Uzi-El for the pic and stats.

fauna.name: Hea Warrior
fauna.offense: Possible Melee Defense: 380
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Totem of Audetaunga.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Cuttler Strongmad, and Roberto.

fauna.name: Hea Windreave
fauna.offense: Possible Melee Defense: 166
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Totem of Tanae.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Mortal Kombat, and Roberto.

fauna.name: Hea Shaman
fauna.offense: Possible Melee Defense: 310
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Totem of Volkama. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Cuttler Strongmad for stats.

fauna.name: Hea Itealuan
fauna.offense: Possible Melee Defense: 278
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Totem of Tanae. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Roberto.

fauna.name: Hea Nualuan
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Totem of Audetaunga. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Thank you Roberto for level update.

fauna.name: Hea Karenua
fauna.treasure: Drops 5 Karenua's Key(s) used to open the Hea Raiders Cache (but you may only pick up one). also drops the "Awakener Drum"
fauna.comments:
Level updated, was 111 now 85. Pic by Pagan Born
Graphics update with Throne of Destiny Expansion.

fauna.name: Hea Kanokeh
fauna.comments: Spawns along with Hea Karenua and Hea Temenua during an active Queen Quest. Level updated was 111, now 85. Thanks to Pagan Born for the pic.

fauna.name: Hea Elder Shaman
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Totem of Volkama. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Cuttler Strongmad for stats.

fauna.name: Hea Tuperea
fauna.offense: This unique monster can cast Item Befoulment, which will decrease the attacker's Item Enchantment skill to 0.
fauna.treasure: Drops the Crop End and the Crop Handle to construct a riding Crop. Also carries a Pouch of Dried Meat for his doggies.
fauna.comments: Runs with his pack of hunting reedsharks. Be warned, these are Virindi augmented reedsharks the likes of which are not seen on Osteth! Thanks to Seraquiel for stats.

fauna.name: Hea Temenua
fauna.treasure: Drops the parts for the Exquisite Elari Bow: the Gromnie Sinew Bowstring and the Greenwood Haft. Also always drops a Hea Totem.
fauna.comments: Only found on Upper Plateau during the Olthoi Queen's Quest. Thanks to Cuttler Strongmad for stats.

fauna.name: Hea Arantah (NPC)
fauna.comments: Thanks Uzi-El for the pic.

fauna.name: The Gatekeeper
fauna.treasure: Often drops a Virindi Singularity Key.

fauna.name: Hollow Minion
fauna.offense: Will only attack if attacked.
fauna.comments: Introduced in the dec 2001 patch.

fauna.name: Hollow Minion Leader
fauna.offense: Will only attack if attacked.
fauna.comments: Introduced in the dec 2001 patch. Drops "crumpled note".

fauna.name: Hollow Minion Invader
fauna.offense: Attacks only when attacked.
fauna.spoiler_general: Found at the bottom of the Academy Training Halls Quest

fauna.name: Hollow Minion (mid)
fauna.treasure: Specific Hollow Minions drop a Storage Key.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Seraquiel for stats.

fauna.name: Hollow Minion (high)
fauna.comments: Thanks to Seraquiel for stats.

fauna.name: Dranith Menacet
fauna.comments: Thanks to Seraquiel for stats.

fauna.name: Sotiris Hollow Minion
fauna.offense: These creatures attack with hollow hands and weapons. Their attack ignores banes and life protection, so wear high AL armor at all times.
fauna.comments: These creatures guard the Sotiris Virindi Director in a direlands dungeon.

fauna.name: Tumideon Hollow Minion
fauna.offense: Wield Hollow hands or Hollow Katars. Hollow weapons pass through all Item and Life magic protections. The only defense is base AL of armor and shield, so wear the highest AL armor you have!
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Virindi Singularity Key.
fauna.comments: Has a very high attack skill, so it can be hard to evade in hand to hand combat.

fauna.name: Terebrous Hollow Minion
fauna.offense: These are some of the hardest hitting monsters in game. They also use hollow fists on top of that, so their punches go right through all life protections (and are unaffected by vulnerabilities).
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Virindi Singularity Key.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Nightwolf of Leafcull for screenshot, and Thanks to Og the One Eye for Magic resistance.

fauna.name: Telumiat Hollow Minion
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Virindi Singularity Key or Telumiat Hollow Minion Mist.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Zarnon of TD, Cleffy of FF.

fauna.name: Martinate Hollow Minion
fauna.offense: Just what Dereth needed, harder Hollow Minions. These creatures attacks are unaffected by Life or Item spells.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Virindi Singularity Key.
fauna.spoiler_general: None

fauna.name: Academy Foreman (NPC)
fauna.offense: N/A
fauna.treasure: N/A
fauna.comments: Part of the Academy Training Halls Quest.

fauna.name: Lou Ka (NPC)
fauna.comments: No man should be parted from his yaoji...especially a citizen of Shoushi.

fauna.name: Academy Quartermaster (NPC)
fauna.offense: N/A
fauna.treasure: N/A
fauna.comments: Male Aluvian Blacksmith Non-Player Killer
fauna.spoiler_general: Found in Academy Training Halls Quest.

fauna.name: Jalina al-Hajj (NPC)
fauna.comments: "The High Queen has commissioned me to create a pennant for all Isparians currently upon Dereth."

fauna.name: Adara al-Rajin (NPC)
fauna.comments: Adara al-Rajin tells you, "High Queen Elysa asked me to create a special raiment for all Isparians who have made Dereth their home." During A New Threat she gives out the Realaidain Raiment.

fauna.name: Scout Luzumin Abigwei (NPC)
fauna.treasure: Scout Luzumin Abigwei tells you, "Please deliver this note to one of the Queen's Royal Guard." Scout Luzumin Abigwei gives you A Note from a Scout.
fauna.comments: You found us! Did the High Queen send you? We came across this group of Olthoi fighters and decided to stay and help them keep the Olthoi at bay. All the portals in the deepend lairs appeared to lead to these catacombs. Perhaps the Olthoi are re-grouping!

fauna.name: Tusker Kin
fauna.comments: Thanks Ncf-Poozer for the info!Thanks to Zen Tek Ken for the update.

fauna.name: Brigand
fauna.treasure: 100% droprate on Eye Patch.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Jediknight II / sim of leafcull for info and Roberto for updated info.

fauna.name: Viamontian Torturer
fauna.comments: Submitted by Druideth of TD

fauna.name: Academy Blacksmith (NPC)
fauna.offense: N/A
fauna.treasure: N/A
fauna.comments: N/A
fauna.spoiler_general: Found in the Academy Training Halls Quest.

fauna.name: Tusker Minion
fauna.comments: Thanks to Borgia of DT and Ncf-Poozer (Image) for this info.Thanks to RTA of FrostFell for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: Viamontian Executioner
fauna.comments: Submitted by Druideth of TD

fauna.name: Alaine the Apprentice (NPC)
fauna.comments: Alaine the Apprentice tells you, "Hello! If you are willing, we have a task for you."

fauna.name: Assassin
fauna.offense: Possible Melee Defense: 224 Possible Attack Skill: 208
fauna.comments: Thanks to Meglo the Maniac, and Roberto. XP updated by Briciu.

fauna.name: Aurten Rhell (NPC)
fauna.comments: Hmmm...something is amiss on the Marcescent Plateau of Marae Lassel.

fauna.name: Greeter (NPC)
fauna.offense: N/A
fauna.treasure: N/A
fauna.comments: Male Aluvian Guard Non-Player Killer

fauna.name: Guard (NPC)
fauna.offense: N/A
fauna.treasure: N/A
fauna.comments: Female Aluvian Soldier Non-Player Killer
fauna.spoiler_general: Found in Academy Training Halls Quest.

fauna.name: Training Master (NPC)
fauna.offense: N/A
fauna.treasure: N/A
fauna.comments: Male Sho Soldier Non-Player Killer
fauna.spoiler_general: Found in the Academy Training Halls Quest.

fauna.name: Senior Guard (NPC)
fauna.offense: N/A
fauna.treasure: N/A
fauna.spoiler_general: Found in Academy Training Halls Quest.

fauna.name: Guard Chandler Hammett (NPC)
fauna.comments: This guard will get your started on your investigation into who tried to kill the Queen.

fauna.name: Samuel, Former Guardian (NPC)
fauna.spoiler_general: This man has lost his nerve. The Caul will do that.

fauna.name: Highwayman
fauna.comments: Thanks to Tsurani the Mage of Frostfell for the pic submission.

fauna.name: Ulgrim the Underdressed, Royal Advisor
fauna.treasure: Ply this one with Wah Chon's Winter Lager for his Splinter.
fauna.comments: Ulgrim the Underdressed tells you, "Hmph! I hear they aren't so prudish on Tusker Island."

fauna.name: Ulgrim the Unintelligible, Royal Advisor
fauna.treasure: Ply this one with Mead for his Splinter.
fauna.comments: Ulgrim the Unintelligible tells you, "Suddy skunk hut, carenzi 7.1 fishpliers! 71.6 Epileptic spongemonkies!"

fauna.name: Ulgrim the Unbalanced, Grand Vizier
fauna.treasure: Ply this one with Sake for his Splinter.
fauna.comments: Ulgrim the Unbalanced tells you, "Easy guys, I drink my stout just like the rest of you - one sip at a time. Except, once my mugs empty, I make gold gromnies."

fauna.name: Ulgrim the Uncooperative, Royal Advisor
fauna.treasure: Ply this one with a Filled Beer Stien (beer mug used on beer stein in a bar) to get his Splinter.
fauna.comments: Ulgrim fakes a whiny voice, "I'm looking for a splinter. I want a piece of wood. Me, me, me! Look at me, I'm a flippin' ponce!"

fauna.name: Ulgrim the Unreal
fauna.treasure: Plied with Ale this one will give you his Splinter...if he doesn't fade away completely first.
fauna.comments: Ulgrim the Unreal tells you, "I - I can see things... horrible things. They're everywhere. Swimming around and through everything like it's not there."

fauna.name: Ulgrim the Uncertain, Royal Advisor
fauna.treasure: Ply this one with Red Wine to ease his tension...err...get his Splinter. Rumor has it he'll really take any alcohol though.
fauna.comments: Ulgrim the Uncertain tells you, "You shouldn't never not remove those labels from mattresses. I don't... wait, yes I do."

fauna.name: Ulgrim the Unlucky, Royal Advisor
fauna.treasure: Some vino rojo will do the trick to get this one's Splinter.
fauna.comments: Ulgrim the Unlucky tells you, "You will fall into a very deep hole and your broken body will slowly be devoured by the foul things that reside in the lightless places."

fauna.name: Ulgrim the Underhanded, Royal Advisor
fauna.treasure: A little Palm wine will get the job done if you want this one's Splinter.
fauna.comments: Ulgrim the Underhanded tells you, "So, are you looking to earn a little extra pyreal on the side? We could perhaps enter into a mutually beneficial arrangement."

fauna.name: Ulgrim the Unclean, Royal Advisor
fauna.treasure: One small beer will make the Splinter yours.
fauna.comments: Ulgrim the Unclean tells you, "Hey, hey, watch the personal space there friend. I'm not one of those support mages! I keep my wand in my pocket, thank you very much."

fauna.name: Ulgrim the Unpleasant, Chess Grandmaster
fauna.treasure: Ulgrim is inexplicably tied to a number of quests. Most recently in April 2004 he was blown into splinters of himself and if you recovered the splinters you'd get a bathrobe.
fauna.comments: Ulgrim the Unpleasant tells you, "After what I've been through, I could sure use a drink."
fauna.location: Ayan, Xara, Dryreach, his island, others

fauna.name: Ulgrim the Unappreciated, Mini-Ulgrim
fauna.treasure: He seeks his mystic beer stein if you desire his casting Mug!!!
fauna.comments: Ulgrim the Unappreciated says, "Wipe your feet! Cleaning house takes time away from my life's endeavor."

fauna.name: Han Rin-Jo, Jojii Adherent (NPC)
fauna.comments: Han Rin-Jo, Jojii Adherent tells you, "In my life, I have seen a great many wonders that have challenged my beliefs, and driven me near the edge of forsaking all that I had known. But in Jojii, I have found the virtuous path."

fauna.name: Ikomi Ra, Jojii Adherent (NPC)
fauna.comments: Ikomi Ra, Jojii Adherent tells you, "I have met the man you seek, this Honshu Takeda."

fauna.name: Miko Li, Jojii Adherent (NPC)
fauna.comments: Miko Li, Jojii Adherent tells you, "You seek the power of the dragon, as did Honshu." Also can produce dyes for sharded Shadowhunter Armor.

fauna.name: Mercenary
fauna.offense: Uses elemental weapons like Frost.
fauna.treasure: May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Meglo the Maniac of WE for stats.

fauna.name: Cutthroat
fauna.offense: Possible Melee Defense: 112 Possible Attack Skill: 170 Possible Deception Skill: 160
fauna.comments: Thanks to Seraquiel for stats and Roberto for updated stats.

fauna.name: Cultist
fauna.treasure: May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Meglo the Maniac of WE for stats. These have clothing, facial and weapon variations

fauna.name: Zharalim
fauna.treasure: May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Although these people appear to be just another player, they are in fact bandits that will attack without warning! Thanks to Thaforge for stats and pic.

fauna.name: Tusker Worshipper
fauna.comments: Thanks Chronos & Brute Force for the info.Thanks to RTA of FrostFell for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: Dame Brinna O'Shea (NPC)
fauna.comments: The dame of fame. The one with the name. The one who puts all others to shame.

fauna.name: Sir Belfelor
fauna.treasure: Drops a Ring of Karlun

fauna.name: Sir Coretto
fauna.comments: Submitted by Druideth of TD

fauna.name: Poacher
fauna.offense: Possible Melee Defense: 328
fauna.treasure: May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Meglot the Maniac, and Roberto. XP updated by Briciu. Are often dressed differently.

fauna.name: Ulgrim the Unruly
fauna.treasure: Kill it!!! Kill it now!!! To get it Splinter that is.
fauna.comments: Ulgrim the Unruly tells you, "I should have taken the red pill."

fauna.name: Xavier, Royal Guard (NPC)
fauna.comments: Loyal to the end.

fauna.name: Rheth Al'Thok
fauna.treasure: Drops the Woven Tassels of Sound Mind

fauna.name: Tiyol Ibn Yufaj
fauna.treasure: Drops the Woven Tassels of Discord

fauna.name: Rayssid Ibn Alhath
fauna.treasure: Drops the Woven Tassels of Far Sight

fauna.name: Honshu Takeda (NPC)
fauna.comments: Honshu Takeda tells you, "You have traveled the same path as I, and learned the lessons of the great spirits. Now you must know how they fit together."

fauna.name: Tusker Sycophant
fauna.offense: Level VI Vulns & War Spells
fauna.weakness: Not much in the way of armour.
fauna.comments: Thanks to RTA of FrosFell for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: Rat Nose (NPC)
fauna.comments: Rat Nose tells you, "Hey, they call me Rat Nose. Because I bit off a rat's nose once. None of your business, but I was hungry if ya must know. Or maybe I just wanted to. Anyway, I'm glad ya brought weapons."

fauna.name: Ripper (NPC)
fauna.comments: Ripper is a big boy (larger than normal toon size). Male Aluvian, Olthoi Fighter, NPK. The big man does not speak, only looks at you with eyes that seem no longer human.

fauna.name: Teela (NPC)
fauna.treasure: Get me a bug's long claw and I might make you one. Make sure the long claw is nice and pointy. And freshly killed.
fauna.comments: Well, honey, it sure is nice to know there's others fighting the Olthoi with us here. Can you really kill 'em with that? I use a nice spear myself. Goes through bug shell like butter. Of course, it's been years since I've tasted butter...

fauna.name: Deranged Sycophant
fauna.comments: VERY Dangerous as they tend to chaincast War VII's in very fast succession. Thanks Seraquiel.

fauna.name: Antius Blackmoor
fauna.comments: Antius next to Elysa, thanks Uzi-El for the pics

fauna.name: Nuhmudira (NPC)
fauna.comments: Thanks to Vlaid of Thistledown for the image/stats.

fauna.name: Ciandra, Arcanum Alchemist (NPC)
fauna.comments: What does her future hold? *grin*

fauna.name: Fadsahil al-Tashbi (NPC)
fauna.comments: With the advent of A New Threat, Fadsahil al-Tashbi got a level bump to 126 and now show's he's a Master Archmage.

fauna.name: Elysa Strathelar
fauna.comments: Thank you to Zeddmon of Wintersebb for stats submission. Thanks Uzi-El for pic

fauna.name: Raven Augur
fauna.comments: Thanks to Marki of MT

fauna.name: Raven Conscript
fauna.offense: This guy does double and triple stikes.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Lithea Sarmad

fauna.name: Martine (Altered Version) (Retired)
fauna.comments: Choose wether Martine takes vengeance upon Asheron. Give him a Tusker husk if you think Asheron should die. Give him the note of a former love to decide that Asheron should live.

fauna.name: Idol
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops the Idol Gem.
fauna.comments: Magic Defense thanks to Og the One Eye.

fauna.name: Dread Idol
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops Idol Gem.

fauna.name: K'nath Z'bog
fauna.offense: Flaming Missile Volley spells. Very odd spells that aren't castable by players.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Brown Lump.

fauna.name: K'nath N'gell
fauna.offense: unknown
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Brown Lump.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Sauron's Bane for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: K'nath S'tath
fauna.offense: unknown
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Brown Lump.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Sauron's Bane for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: Anger
fauna.treasure: Drops the Symbol of Love on the Marriage "Quest".
fauna.comments: Overcome Anger on your way to getting married! Thanks to Shalone Bloodtide of LC for stats and pic.

fauna.name: Greed
fauna.treasure: Drops the Symbol of Honor on the Marriage "Quest".
fauna.comments: Overcome Greed on your way to getting married! Thanks to Shalone Bloodtide of LC for stats and pic.

fauna.name: Jealousy
fauna.treasure: Drops the Symbol of Friendship on the Marriage "Quest".
fauna.comments: Overcome Jealousy on your way to getting married! Thanks to Shalone Bloodtide of LC for stats and pic.

fauna.name: K'nath N'osaj
fauna.offense: unknown
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Brown Lump.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Sauron's Bane for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: K'nath D'Nob
fauna.offense: unknown
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Brown Lump.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Sauron's Bane for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: K'nath T'aed
fauna.offense: Flaming missiles, minor blunt attacks. Generally non-dangerous.
fauna.weakness: Very slow, an mage or archer should have no trouble killing one before it reaches them.
fauna.treasure: Usually junk, occasional magic orb or wand. Sometimes drops a Brown Lump.
fauna.comments: There is speculation that their flaming missile attack is a war spell currently unavailable to players.

fauna.name: K'nath La'nal
fauna.offense: Level VII War spells, Arcs and lots of them.
fauna.weakness: Usually run out of mana fairly quickly.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Mangled Dark Key or a Twisted Dark Key. Sometimes drops a Brown Lump.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Semiramis of LC.Thanks to Zen Tek Ken for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: K'nath An'dras
fauna.offense: level VI/VII War Spells and Arc spells, and lots of them.
fauna.weakness: They eventually run out of mana.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Mangled Dark Key or a Twisted Dark Key. Sometimes drops a Brown Lump.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Semiramis.Thanks to Zen Tek Ken for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: K'nath G'erg
fauna.offense: Level VI/VII War Spells and Arc spells, and lots of them
fauna.weakness: They eventually run out of mana.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Mangled Dark Key or a Twisted Dark Key. Sometimes drops a Brown Lump.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Semiramis of Leafcull.Thanks to Zen Tek Ken for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: K'nath N'aes
fauna.offense: level VI/VII War Spells and Arc spells, and lots of them.
fauna.weakness: They eventually run out of mana.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Mangled Dark Key or a Twisted Dark Key. Sometimes drops a Brown Lump.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Semiramis of leafcull.

fauna.name: K'nath S'el
fauna.offense: Level VI/VII War Spells and Arc spells, and lots of them.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Mangled Dark Key or a Twisted Dark Key. Sometimes drops a Brown Lump.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Semiramis of Leafcull

fauna.name: K'nath S'hirc
fauna.offense: Level VI/VII War Spells and Arc spells, and lots of them.
fauna.weakness: Eventually they run out of mana.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Mangled Dark Key or a Twisted Dark Key. Sometimes drops a Brown Lump.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Semiramis of Leafcull.

fauna.name: Static
fauna.offense: Electrical attacks and spells
fauna.comments: The cutest of the new elemental creatures. Pyreal Rat wants one as a pet. Thanks to Sauron's Bane for Magic defense.
fauna.spoiler_general: These guard a quest item in the new event.

fauna.name: Scintilla
fauna.offense: Electrical Attacks, and massive spells.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Sauron's Bane for Magic Defense.Thank you to Dindas Fury of Thistledown for pic submission.
fauna.spoiler_general: These guard a quest item introduced in The Shadows of the Past event

fauna.name: Charge
fauna.offense: Lightning War Magic/Life Magic Self Buffing/Draining

fauna.name: Voltarc
fauna.offense: Lightning War Magic/Life Magic Self Buffing/Draining
fauna.comments: XP updated by Briciu.

fauna.name: Synnast
fauna.comments: Thanks to Meglo the Maniac of WE for stats.

fauna.name: Scathisa
fauna.comments: Thanks to Seraquiel for stats.Thanks to Zen Tek Ken for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: Astyrrian
fauna.offense: Ligtning Spells/Debuffs Drains
fauna.weakness: Any attack other than an Acid based one will be an exercise in futillity.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Sauron's Bane for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: Tempest (Retired)
fauna.offense: Level VII Magic in all Schools, Lightning based War/Melee attacks. Drain VII's and Critter VII debuffs including Belly of Lead.
fauna.treasure: None
fauna.comments:
The Essensce of Lightning Incarnate.
Thanks to Paul Shadowblade of Leafcull for Submission.

fauna.name: Laigus Lugian
fauna.offense: Fairly strong melee attacks, no magic or ranged weapons.
fauna.weakness: They're slow so ranged attackers do well against them.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Zax for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: Amploth Lugian
fauna.offense: Strong melee fighters, but generally lack ranged attacks.
fauna.weakness: They're pretty slow, allowing mages and archers to take them down from a distance.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Zax for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: Amploth Raider
fauna.comments: This Lugian Raider uses hollow weapons imbued with Chorizite.

fauna.name: Obeloth Lugian
fauna.offense: Melee and Ranged Rock Throw (Bludgeoning)
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops Small Lugian Sinew.

fauna.name: Obeloth Raider
fauna.comments: Thanks to Zaophang for stats. XP updated by Briciu.

fauna.name: Lithos Lugian
fauna.offense: Melee, Ranged Rock Throw (Bludgeoning)
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops Small Lugian Sinew.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Zax for Magic Defense. XP updated by Briciu.

fauna.name: Lithos Raider
fauna.treasure: Small Lugian Sinew
fauna.comments: Thanks to Zaophang for stats and pic. XP updated by Briciu.

fauna.name: Gigas Lugian
fauna.offense: Throws Boulders and has melee weapons.
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops Large Lugian Sinew. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: XP updated by Briciu. In order to get Lugians to switch from their boulders to melee weapons, run around them in a circle, they cannot track you.

fauna.name: Gigas Raider
fauna.offense: These lugians are both hollow and magic resistant, so be careful around them!
fauna.treasure: May drop a Large Lugian Sinew.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Seraquiel for stats and pic! XP updated by Briciu.

fauna.name: Master of The Hunt
fauna.comments: Part of the Arm, heart & Mind Quest.Thanks to Aesa for the Stats and image.

fauna.name: Lieutenant
fauna.comments: Thanks to Aesa for stats & image. Part of the Arm, heart & Mind Quest.

fauna.name: Drawohan the Gem Seller (NPC)
fauna.comments: Lugian NPC found in the town of Yaraq. Sells Gems of Protection, also sells Strong Benevolence used to craft the Spear of Purity. part of the Arm, Heart & Mind Quest.

fauna.name: Novedion the Gem Seller (NPC)
fauna.comments:
Lugian NPC Vendor found in the town of Holtburg. Sells Gems of Protection, also sells Benevolent Calm used to craft the Staff of Clarity. Part of the Arm, Heart & Mind Quest.
Moved from Rithwic to Holtburg during A New Threat.

fauna.name: Oneros the Gem Seller (NPC)
fauna.comments: Lugian NPC Vendor found in the town of Nanto. Sells Gems of Protection, also sells Calm Strength used to craft the Sleeves of Inexhaustability. Part of the Arm, Heart & Mind Quest.

fauna.name: Aurutis (NPC)
fauna.comments: Lugian NPC found in the city of Linvak Tukal. part of the Arm, Heart & Mind Quest.

fauna.name: Tornash Lugian Noble (NPC)
fauna.comments: Found near the Crystal Mines Portal. Part of the Gift Box Quest.

fauna.name: Olcris (NPC)
fauna.comments: Sells Portal Gems to Knorr

fauna.name: Lugian Warlord
fauna.offense: Very rare spawn, these guys are very hard to find.
fauna.treasure: Known to drop the Soul Staff. May drop a Large Lugian Sinew. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Josui Hideyoshi of Darktide for exp value.

fauna.name: Mite Snippet
fauna.offense: Mainly barehanded bludgeoning attacks.

fauna.name: Mite Scion
fauna.offense: Fists and feet.
fauna.weakness: Lightly armored. Vulnerable to Low attacks.
fauna.treasure: Food and pyreals. The occasional magic component.
fauna.comments: Extremely quick and persistent with an annoying piping shrill. These beasts will wear down adventurers in no time, and slice them to pieces once they're exhausted. Lethal in packs. These are the weakest, and they're still tough.

fauna.name: Mite Scamp
fauna.offense: Fists and feet.
fauna.weakness: Lightly armored. Vulnerable to Low attacks.
fauna.treasure: Food, pyreals, the occasional non-magical weapon.
fauna.comments: Extremely quick and persistent with an annoying piping shrill. These beasts will wear down adventurers in no time, and slice them to pieces once they're exhausted. Lethal in packs.

fauna.name: Mite Digger
fauna.offense: Fists and feet.
fauna.weakness: Lightly armored. Vulnerable to Low attacks.
fauna.treasure: Non-magical gems and jewelry, food, the occasional non-magical weapon.
fauna.comments: Extremely quick and persistent with an annoying piping shrill. These beasts will wear down adventurers in no time, and slice them to pieces once they're exhausted. Lethal in packs. Thanks to Mad Prophet for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: Mite Squib
fauna.offense: Melee

fauna.name: Mite Sentry
fauna.offense: Fists and feet.
fauna.treasure: Very little. Some pyreals, sometimes food, rarely anything else. Not worth the hunting for the looting.
fauna.comments: Extremely quick and persistent with an annoying piping shrill. Lethal in packs. These Mites have an unusally high melee defense skill, making them difficult to kill for even 15-20th level fighters.

fauna.name: Mite Squire
fauna.offense: Fists and feet.
fauna.weakness: Lightly armored. Vulnerable to Low attacks.
fauna.treasure: Food, pyreals, magic components, magical and non-magical gems and jewelry, the occasional magic or non-magic weapon or armor.
fauna.comments: Extremely quick and persistent with an annoying piping shrill. Easier to kill than Sentries, surprisingly, but as they're nearly always found in groups, more hazardous. Thanks to Sauron's Bane for magic defense.

fauna.name: Mite Matron

fauna.name: Outcast Monouga
fauna.offense: Heavy bludgeoning weapons such as morningstars, maces, and clubs. Heavy slashing weapons such as axes. Frequently seen with throwing clubs.
fauna.weakness: Lightly armored, relatively slow, nearly no magic resistance.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops Monougat.
fauna.comments: The stepchild of the Monouga race, these beasts are great for 3-7th level adventurers to whip up on for quick experience. Killing it, as with all Monougas, is like chopping down a tree.

fauna.name: Outcast Lord
fauna.comments: Thanks to Cuttler Strongmad of Morningthaw and Shinobu Satouchi of Morningthaw.

fauna.name: Rough Monouga
fauna.offense: Heavy bludgeoning weapons such as morningstars, maces, and clubs. Heavy slashing weapons such as axes. Rarely seen with throwing clubs.
fauna.weakness: Lightly armored, relatively slow, not very magic resistant.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops Monougat.
fauna.comments: Big, dumb, and slow, but if it hits, it hurts. Any decent armor (chainmail or above) will lessen the damage these things do. Killing it, as with all Monougas, is like chopping down a tree. Thanks to Og the One Eye for the magic defense.

fauna.name: Crude Monouga
fauna.offense: Heavy bludgeoning weapons such as morningstars, maces, and clubs. Heavy slashing weapons such as axes. Rarely seen with throwing clubs.
fauna.weakness: Lightly armored, relatively slow, slightly magic resistant.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops Monougat.
fauna.comments: The only flesh-colored Monouga, this one's mildly creepy to look at. It's still a Monouga, though, which means dumb, slow, and killing it's like chopping down a tree. Thanks to Zaphod for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: Wild Monouga
fauna.offense: Heavy bludgeoning weapons such as morningstars, maces, and clubs. Heavy slashing weapons such as axes. Rarely seen with throwing clubs.
fauna.weakness: Lightly armored, relatively slow, medium-strength magic resistance.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops Monougat.
fauna.comments: Big, dumb, and slow, but if it hits, it hurts. Any decent armor (chainmail or above) will lessen the damage these things do. Killing it, as with all Monougas, is like chopping down a tree.

fauna.name: Brutish Monouga
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Ruined Amulet of the Pugilist or Monougat.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Phoenix Wolfsun (TD) for creature stats. Thanks to Yew Wan Sum for Magic Defense.
fauna.spoiler_general: Introduced with the march patch, these monougas are much harder than their older brothers.

fauna.name: Wily Monouga
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops Monougat.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Phoenix Wolfsun (TD) for stats. Thanks to Yew Wan Sum for magic defense. XP updated by Briciu.
fauna.spoiler_general: Introduced in the March 2001 patch.

fauna.name: Ferocious Monouga
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops Monougat or the Ruined Amulet of the Spear.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Phoenix Wolfsun (TD) for stats. Thanks to Yew Wan Sum for magic defense.
fauna.spoiler_general: Introduced with the March 2001 patch.

fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops Monougat.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Karza of Leafcull.

fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops Monougat.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Faulkon and PJ of Harvestgain.

fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops Monougat or a Bloodthirsty Monogua Idol.

fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops Monougat or a Merciless Monogua Idol.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Sek the Wise.

fauna.name: Tremendous Monouga (Beta)
fauna.offense: Fists and feet. Oh my God.
fauna.treasure: Unknown.
fauna.comments: In this corner, at 40 feet tall and weighing in at 12 tons, the Tremendous Monouga! If you're feeling like David, here's your Goliath... and then some. Bring friends. Lots of friends.

fauna.name: Paul the Monouga
fauna.offense: None, but that Axe he carries sure is mighty.
fauna.treasure: None, he cannot be killed.
fauna.comments: He is found with his trusty pal, Babe the Blue Auroch. Thanks to topheron for stats.

fauna.name: Tremendous Monouga
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops Monougat. Drops a Twisted Dark Key.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Max Fox of FrostFell. Thanks to Zkra of Leafcull for the image. Thanks to Max Fox of FrestFell for the stats.

fauna.name: Thieving Mosswart
fauna.offense: Will only attack if attacked.
fauna.treasure: Drops the Bellows belonging to the Academy Blacksmith.
fauna.comments: Introduced in the december 2001 patch. Added to teach new characters some quest mechanics. Drops Bellows.

fauna.name: Mosswart Kin
fauna.offense: Will only attack if attacked.
fauna.comments: Added in the december 2001 patch to teach new characters some quest mechanics.

fauna.name: Young Mosswart
fauna.offense: While week by themselves, these Mosswart are rarely found far from the protective embrace of other mosswarts. Be careful when approaching as others may be nearby, ready to rush to its aid.
fauna.weakness: Most suseptable to low and high attacks. Fire and electricity along with piercing and slashing work better then other attack types.
fauna.treasure: Usually a few magic components such as tapers, scarabs, or herbs. Sometimes drops a Peppermint Stick or an Academy Stamp or Brown Beans.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Mad Prophet for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: Creeper Mosswart
fauna.treasure: Brown Beans, Peppermint Stick, Academy Stamp.

fauna.name: Mosswart Feeder
fauna.offense: Fists and feet. Sometimes uses small piercing and slashing weapons. Occasionally has small throwing weapons.
fauna.treasure: Food and pyreals, with the occasional weapon. Also few magic components such as tapers, scarabs, or herbs. Sometimes drops a Peppermint Stick or an Academy Stamp or Brown Beans.
fauna.comments: Although he looks and acts like a Creeper, he's much better at evading melee attacks.

fauna.name: Mudlurk Mosswart
fauna.offense: Medium-sized slashing and piercing weapons--short swords, scimitars, shamshir, khanjar, spear. Often seen with throwing weapons such as javelins, djarids, shouken, and knives. Also uses fists and feet
fauna.treasure: From food through pyreals to non-magical weapons. About 1 in 20 might have a small pile of Brown Beans or Swamp Stones
fauna.comments: The Barker's baby brother, he's quick and tenacious, but much more killable

fauna.name: Barker Mosswart
fauna.offense: Medium-sized slashing and piercing weapons--short swords, scimitars, shamshir, khanjar, spear. Often seen with throwing weapons such as javelins, djarids, shouken, and knives. Also uses fists and feet. Versatile.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops an Academy Stamp or Brown Beans.
fauna.comments: Definitely the "warrior" Mosswart, the Barker is a hard fighter and a good dodger. Seems to be able to summon other Mosswarts to his aid. Do not underestimate.

fauna.name: Mosswart Mucker
fauna.offense: Fists and feet. Sometimes uses small piercing and slashing weapons. Very rarely he'll be a thrower.
fauna.weakness: Lightly armored. Doesn't like bludgeoning attacks.
fauna.treasure: Food, pyreals, magic jewelry, weapons, and high-AL crafted armor. Also, Muckers will carry either an Ice Tachi or Acid Axe. Rumors persist about a flame-weapon-carrying Mucker, but have not been verified.
fauna.comments: Though he looks like a Mudlurk, he's a bit faster and quite a bit harder to kill. Since he has fixed spawn points, you'll usually find him being camped by adventurers. Thanks to Mad Prophet for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: Rumuba the Mosswart (NPC)
fauna.comments: Part of Rumuba's Jade Spear Quest.

fauna.name: Mosswart Shaman
fauna.offense: Scimitar, spear, II and III-level war and creature magic. Extremely dangerous for his level.
fauna.weakness: Doesn't know when to run. Often focuses on the strongest opponent--rather than the weakest--in a group of enemies.
fauna.treasure: Magic and non-magic weapons, armor, jewelry, and gems. Pyreals and food. Occasionally drops a Swamp Stone or Mosswart Head. Sometimes drops an Academy Stamp or Brown Beans.
fauna.comments: He'll lead with two spells from a distance, if he can. Will also cast when he gets down to 50% of his total hit points. Flighty; will often switch targets in the middle of battle. Extremely dangerous when cornered or when there's more than one.

fauna.name: Mosswart Chief
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Swamp Stone or Brown Beans.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Mad Prophet for Magic defense.

fauna.name: Master of the Swamp
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Swamp Stone.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Seraquiel for stats and pic.

fauna.name: Grearrk, Mosswart Emissary (NPC)
fauna.comments:
This Mosswart ran out of the swamps and into Sawato in search of help from Humans.
Thanks to Zaerik for the info.

fauna.name: Mosswart Idolator
fauna.offense: Loves to cast Imperils and Fire / lightning vulns. Known to use flaming weapons as well. Hits harder than one would expect.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Ruined Amulet of the Arm. Sometimes drops a Swamp Stone or Brown Beans.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Topheron for Stats, and to Sauron's Bane for magic defense.

fauna.name: Mosswart Fanatic
fauna.offense: Use fire weapons...be careful, as they're rarely alone...and their cohorts like to cast Fire Vulnerability and Imperil.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Ruined Amulet of the Left Hand. Sometimes drops a Swamp Stone or Brown Beans.

fauna.name: Mosswart Zealot
fauna.offense: Uses Flaming Swords & Spears.
fauna.weakness: Slightly more vulnearble to Fire,Pierce & Bludgeon Dmg.
fauna.treasure: Ruined Amulet of the Right Hand. Sometimes drops a Swamp Stone or Brown Beans.

fauna.name: Mosswart Soul Trapper

fauna.name: Swamp Rat
fauna.offense: Piercing attack and lightning breath weapon.
fauna.treasure: Occasional magic jewelry, spell components
fauna.comments: They usually come in groups, so be wary. Electrical attacks usually do very heavy damage from the back, and a group of them can quickly sap even the most sturdy of warrior's stamina. Thanks to Og the One Eye for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: Black Rat
fauna.offense: Teeth, little jagged ivory Teeth. Gnaw gnaw gnaw.
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops a Black Rat Tail.

fauna.name: Desert Rat
fauna.offense: Low Piercing Damage and Cold/Frost breath weapon
fauna.treasure: unknown
fauna.comments: Thanks to Sauron's Bane for magic defense.

fauna.name: Mountain Rat
fauna.offense: Melee and a fire breath attack that does a large amount of damage for their level.
fauna.comments: Very fast, very painful and twice the size of thier cousins. Do not underestimate these rodents of unusual size.

fauna.name: Silver Rat
fauna.offense: unknown
fauna.treasure: unknown
fauna.comments: Evil, evil things. Arguably the most annoyingly dangerous creature on Dereth. XP updated by Briciu.

fauna.name: Sewer Rat

fauna.name: Reedshark Pup

fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops a Small Reedshark Hide, pyreals, some magic components, food. Often empty.
fauna.comments: The littlest reedshark can deal up to five times normal damage if it gets you from the rear. Even this 5th-level beast shouldn't be taken lightly, as it can be challenging to lone characters up to 10th level.

fauna.name: Rickety Scarecrow
fauna.offense: REALLY hates to be assessed.
fauna.treasure: Always drops a stack of 12 Jack-O-Laterns. One or two other small items may also be found on them.
fauna.comments: These creatures can and do remain inactive until you "trigger" them. If you see one wielding a pumpking in its hand, then its likely just waiting for the right moment to attack.

fauna.name: Suspicious Scarecrow
fauna.offense: Throws Jack'O Lanterns, which do bludgeoning damage.
fauna.treasure: Usually drops Jack'O Lanterns as well as other low level creature loot.
fauna.comments: REALLY hates to be assessed.

fauna.name: Shifty Scarecrow
fauna.offense: Throws fiery pumpkins... but the pumpkin hits you before the fire, so no elemental damage.
fauna.comments: REALLY hates to be assessed.
fauna.location: Appears to be the Heartland area

fauna.name: Shady Scarecrow (old)
fauna.offense: Throws Jack'O Lanterns. Uses level 2 magic aggressively...but it does have spell buildup sounds and time.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Pumpkin Head.
fauna.comments: REALLY hates to be assessed.

fauna.name: Shadow Sprite
fauna.comments: At this time, very little is know about this creature as it has only appeared with the latest shadow offensive. Thanks go to Rend the Berzerker and Bats for providing what information we do have.

fauna.name: Shadow Child
fauna.offense: Don't be fooled by the low self, these are magical creatures and they use level III war magic effectively. They also are strong melee fighters and sometimes carry thorwing knives or darts as well. Possible Attack Skill: 235
fauna.weakness: More vulnerable to slashing and fire.
fauna.treasure: Mostly gems and jewelry with ocasional reagents. Every now and then a low level wand or orb, or a Dark Speck will show up. Sometimes drops a Fenmalain Key.
fauna.comments: Mages, remember to drain mana. If done right they can be killed while you loose less than 10 mana. Thanks to Mad Prophet for Magic Defense. Thanks to Uzi-El.

fauna.name: Shadow
fauna.offense: Shadows combine physical power with strong magical skill to form a very deadly monster. They are known to use up to level V war and creature magic and can also hit for over 70 points of damage. Possible Attack Skill: 197
fauna.weakness: More vulnerable to slashing and fire.
fauna.treasure: Ranges from nothing to level III and IV wands. They often carry gems and magical jewelry as well as elemental weapons. Occasionally they will drop a Dark Sliver or a Fenmalain Key.
fauna.comments: They have a disturbing ability to cast stamina to health just before you kill them. They also heal themselves often, and regenerate quickly. Thanks to Optim Shi.

fauna.name: Fenmalain Shadow Leader
fauna.treasure: Drops an Oozing Lump.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Quendor.

fauna.name: Caulnalain Shadow Leader
fauna.treasure: Drops a Pulsing Lump.
fauna.comments: Thank you Koga of leafcull for the pic & stats submissions

fauna.name: Shadow Lieutenant
fauna.offense: Lieutenants are capable of melee attacks doing over 100 points of damage and throw level V magic around constantly. Extremely high magic resistance.
fauna.weakness: More vulnerable to Slashing and Fire.
fauna.treasure: Nice stuff. They carry III+ wands and orbs about 25% of the time, and up to level V enchantments have been found on equipment coming off of them. They may also drop a Dark Sliver or a Caulnalain Key on rare occasions. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments:
Extremely dangerous creatures. Be very careful when attacking one.
Thanks to Quendor.
Whoohoo! Entry #100
fauna.location: All over, during the Dark Thaw.

fauna.name: Panumbris Shadow
fauna.offense: Very fast, Lots of level V spells. Debuffs and War abound. Be very careful. Massive bludgeoning unarmed attacks. Can do > 150 damage in one shot.
fauna.weakness: Slightly more vulnerable to fire and slashing
fauna.treasure: On rare occasions they will drop a Dark Shard or a Bael'Zharon Stamp. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments:
These creatures utilize an odd AI that makes them fairly easy for archers to kill them if they can take a single punch.
Thanks to Bran-Li, and Quendor.
fauna.location: Common around Dereth, during the Events

fauna.name: Banished Shadow
fauna.treasure: Always drops Banished Bow.

fauna.name: Pandemonium Shadow
fauna.treasure: May drop a Dark Shard or a Virindi Singularity Key. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Yojiritsu of Frostfell, and Quendor.Thanks to Yachi of Wintersebb for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: Umbris Shadow
fauna.offense: The largest of the shadow family to date. These shadows use no weapon, and punch for extreme amounts of bludgeoning damage, as well as throw level V and VI spells like candy. Possible Attack Skill: 372 Possible Deception Skill: 285
fauna.weakness: Fire and Slashing are the most effective types of damage to deal unto them.
fauna.treasure: Very good treasure. Olthoi Noble quality loot. Level V and VI items, +60 damage modifier items on occasion. But like all treasure in game, it is random. Most will be expensive 'junk.' On rare occasions, they may drop a Dark Shard or a Bael'Zharon Stamp. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Phergus, and Quendor. XP updated by Briciu. Seems like it dropped from 24,000 to 21,488.
fauna.spoiler_general: Usually appear in Direlands Shadow spawns. 1 Shadow, 1 Shadow Lieutenant, 1 Panumbris and 2 Umbris Shadows. As of the Hero's Respite event, they had a bugged AI that allowed them to be killed easily by ranged attacks.

fauna.treasure: May drop a Dark Shard or a Virindi Singularity Key. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Pyreal Melt, and Dar'van al-Zanuff.

fauna.name: Skeleton
fauna.offense: Usually by weapon. Possible Attack Skill: 58 Possible Attack Skill: 82 Possible Deception Skill: 58
fauna.weakness: extremely suseptable to blunt damage attacks
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops Skeleton's Skull or A Tiny Mnemosyne. Also, all basic Skeleton class creatures can drop a Skeletal Arm, Skeletal Leg or Skeletal Torso.
fauna.comments: Can sometimes remain hidden until you get very close to them. They will then stand and attack. Thanks to Quendor and Maddy.
fauna.spoiler_general: Skeletons are extremely supportive and other skeletons will come from great distances to aid another. So keep one eye on your radar view when fighting them.

fauna.name: Old Bones
fauna.offense: unknown
fauna.treasure: All basic Skeleton class creatures can drop a Skeletal Arm, Skeletal Leg or Skeletal Torso. May drop A Tiny Mnemosyne.

fauna.name: Skeleton Warrior
fauna.offense: By weapon. Seems to prefer crossbows and axes.
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops Skeleton's Skull or A Tiny Mnemosyne. Also, all basic Skeleton class creatures can drop a Skeletal Arm, Skeletal Leg or Skeletal Torso.
fauna.comments:
Rarely found alone, other skeletons will come over great distances to aid their fellows. So keep an eye on your radar.
Thanks to Uzi-El.

fauna.weakness: Bludgeon, Fire and Acid. Always attack skeletons at middle height.

fauna.name: Relic Bones
fauna.offense: Will not hesitate to drain or harm. uses high powered Fire and bludgeoning melee. Often found with shields, and almost never alone. Not to be messed with lightly. Possible Attack Skill: 355 Possible Deception Skill: 285
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops A Large Mnemosyne. Also, all basic Skeleton class creatures can drop a Skeletal Arm, Skeletal Leg or Skeletal Torso.

fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops A Large Mnemosyne.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Anodyne Five of WE, and Optim Shi. XP updated by Briciu.

fauna.name: Cursed Bones
fauna.offense: Will cast Drains and harms, and are extremely hard to kill. They are almost always found with a shield, and are thusly hard to melee. Rarely found alone. Either use Fire or bludgeon melee.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops A Large Mnemosyne.
fauna.comments: Thanks to DaZ, Khaine LC, and Quendor. Thanks to Tabu for the image.
fauna.spoiler_general: Often found in the undead town of Aerlinthe.

fauna.name: Great Skeleton
fauna.offense: Uses acid attacks, frequently. Debuffs his victims (and you will be) with Imperil and Vulnerability. Aggressively drains to replenish health.
fauna.weakness: The shield only faces forward. And he will switch off to the last person that attacked him...so get behind him.
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops Skeleton's Skull or a Skull Stamp. Sometimes drops A Large Mnemosyne. Also, all basic Skeleton class creatures can drop a Skeletal Arm, Skeletal Leg or Skeletal Torso. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Dierdre the Pain of TD, and Zyrca.

fauna.weakness: Slashing and Fire seem to be the favorite for these creatures.
fauna.comments: These are very unique creatures, as they are immobile. Their magic skill, and strenght in numbers make them a formidable foe. Thanks to Zubon for Magic Defense.
fauna.spoiler_general: Only found on the Vesayan Isles.

fauna.comments: Get one to chase you. Most comical animation in Asheron's Call. Thanks to Zaphod for Magic Defense.

fauna.treasure: Always drops: 1 x Carrot, 12 x Iceball, 2 x Magic Iceball, 2 x Poofy Snowball. Sometimes drops a Lump of Coal.
fauna.comments: Has a serious identity crisis, will attack one second then heal/buff you the next! Poor bipolar snowman! Like Scarecrows ill immediately attack upon being assessed.

Tusker was quite big!

fauna.name: Lich
fauna.offense:
Level IV enchantments and bolt spells. Often use missile attacks.
Possible Deception Skill: 110 Possible Attack Skill: 162
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops Undead Thighbone. Sometimes drops A Small Mnemosyne. Also, all basic Undead class creatures can drop an Undead Arm, Undead Leg or Undead Torso.

fauna.treasure: A quest item, and some other low level lich-like loot.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Sauron's Bane for Magic Defense.
fauna.spoiler_general: This is a weaker boss character than the regular priests who guard him...be very careful though, he does sling spells quickly.

fauna.name: Tortured Soul
fauna.offense: Behaves much like a lich.
fauna.treasure: Lich like treasure, mostly gems and jewelry, occasional magic item.
fauna.spoiler_general: Also drops a quest item...

fauna.name: Guardian of the Helm
fauna.offense: Level 3 and 4 Spells. Good attack. Usually defended by nearby liches with ranged attack.
fauna.treasure: Very specific items, usually drops Superior Helm and/or Fiery Shield.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Sauron's Bane for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: Baron of Colier
fauna.offense: Fairly weak for a level 20, usually has a ranged weapon. Might cast spells but usually doesn't live long enough to be sure.
fauna.weakness: Fire is a good element of choice; all physical attacks are about the same in effectiveness
fauna.treasure: Usually several gems.
fauna.comments: Interesting character, and like everyone with a name he's dead. The mine is difficult to penetrate though, and there are many keys necessary to open the various doors and chests. Thanks to Sauron's Bane, and Quendor.

fauna.name: Wari al Sha'im
fauna.offense: Equivalent to a Lich.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Circeus. Found in Sylsfear Dungeon has the Ruby Al-Khur (Blood Drinker VI) for the Sifili of Crimson Stars

fauna.name: Risen Soldier
fauna.offense: Does not use magic, but can often be found with a shield making them hard to kill.
fauna.treasure: May drop an Undead Thighbone or a Seal.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Topheron, Lucrenda of FF, Alextium of WE, Circeus, and Uzi-El. XP updated by Briciu. Thanks to Tabu for the image

fauna.name: Lich Lord
fauna.offense: Level IV and V war magic and debuffs. Possible Attack Skill: 220
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops a Seal or an Undead Thighbone. Sometimes drops A Small Mnemosyne or a Ruined Amulet of the Staff. Also, all basic Undead class creatures can drop an Undead Arm, Undead Leg or Undead Torso.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Loka Wu, Alextium of WE, Quendor and Uzi-El.
fauna.spoiler_general: Be wary fighting these high level undead. They can affect even the most stout fighter's ability to fight with a few enchantments that now last several minutes. Fairly high magic resistance too.

fauna.name: High Acolyte
fauna.treasure: Drops the Skull of the High Acolyte.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Topheron, and Quendor.

fauna.weakness: Possible Melee Defense: 223 Possible Melee Defense: 256 Possible Melee Defense: 223 Possible Melee Defense: 256
fauna.treasure: May drop a Seal. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Topheron, Seraquiel, Quendor, and Aesa. XP updated by Briciu.

fauna.treasure: Carries staff required for the Impious Staff Quest This staff is crafted from a strange alloy. The staff is clearly broken. There are several areas where the alloy has been exposed to corrosives. You must be Gharu'ndim to eventually use this item.

fauna.name: Lich Overseer
fauna.offense: Surrounded by a host of skeletons.
fauna.comments: Thanks to topheron for stats.
fauna.spoiler_general: Kill the overseer first to destroy his companions.

"Staff of Nullification" used to "damage" the nearby "Dark Sarcophagus".
Sometimes drops an Undead Femur Bone.

fauna.comments: Thanks to Sauron's Bane, and Quendor.

Singularity Weapon Upgrades.
Virindi Castaway tells you, "Whyyyyy? My Master has not come to see me in so long. Prepare the Black Dominion for my return, he said. They say he is gone. Lies. Please. He would want me to help you. Yesss. Give me your pr

fauna.name: Virindi Puppet
fauna.offense: Far more difficult than their higher level cousins. Possible Attack Skill: 67
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops Red Jewel or a Virindi Master Key.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Quendor.

fauna.name: Virindi Servant
fauna.offense: Possible Deception Skill: 333
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops Blue Jewel or a Virindi Master Key or a Virindi Directive Key. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Bob Down, and Quendor. XP updated by Briciu.

fauna.name: Leopold (NPC)
fauna.comments: Virindi NPC found in Ayan Baqur, he will Craft all types of Broken Vindi Masks back into a usable form.He also recharges mana in them free of charge.

fauna.name: Claude the Archmage (NPC)
fauna.comments: NPC Virindi Mage Vendor found in Ayan Baqur.

fauna.name: Singular Virindi Servant

fauna.name: Virindi Master
fauna.offense: Level 3/4 Debuffs and Level 3/4 War Spells Possible Attack Skill: 227
fauna.weakness: Seems to be especially vulnerable to slashing dmg.
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops White Jewel, a Broken Virindi Mask or a Virindi Stamp. Also known to drop a Virindi Singularity Key, Virindi Master Key or a Virindi Directive Key. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments:
XP 11205 with a lvl 48 char (down from 13.5k)
Thanks to Bob Down.

fauna.name: Virindi Director
fauna.offense: Level VI Spells, especially loves to cast Bludgeon Vuln VI making you ripe for his Tusker Buddies. Possible Attack Skill: 170 Possible Ranged Skill: 142
fauna.weakness: Seems to be especially weak to slashing dmg. Possible Melee Defense: 348 Possible Melee Defense: 278
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops White Jewel, a Broken Virindi Mask, a Virindi Directive Key or a Virindi Stamp.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Hamwell Cogsworth, and Quendor.

fauna.name: Dirrich The Warden
fauna.treasure: Drops the "Shackles of Obedience"

fauna.name: Narrow Rift
fauna.offense: Even with my most powerful sword of fire, I hit this Being for 0 points of damage!
fauna.comments: Definitely an odd creature, not very melee friendly. Thanks to Bran-Li. Xp updated by Briciu.

fauna.name: Virindi Councillor
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a White Jewel, a Virindi Directive Key, a Virindi Singularity Key or a Virindi Stamp. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.

fauna.name: Geraux the Legate

fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a White Jewel or a Broken Virindi Mask or a Virindi Directive Key. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.

fauna.name: Cazamal the Envoy
fauna.comments: Thanks to Quendor.

fauna.name: Virindi Observer
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Yellow Jewel, a Virindi Singularity Key, a Virindi Directive Key or a Virindi Stamp. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Seraquiel, Zyrca, and Maddy.
fauna.location: All over the direlands and northern ML

fauna.name: Virindi Preceptor
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Virindi Directive Key, a Virindi Stamp, a Virindi Singularity Key or a Yellow Jewel. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Aesa.Thanks to Zen Tek Ken for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: Virindi Executor
fauna.offense: Extremely dangerous. Will cast level 6 vulns and war. Also has a very strong slashing melee attack. Almost invulnerable to melee damage, magic seems to be the only way to damage them, but you need an extremely high skill to land spells.
fauna.weakness: Will raise his magic defense extremely quickly until even the highest level mage cannot touch it so kill it fast.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Yellow Jewel or a Virindi Singularity Key or a Virindi Directive Key. Also drops the Virindi Stamp. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Zax, Maggie the Jackcat, Zyrca, and Optim Shi.
fauna.spoiler_general: Found around Ayan Baqur, often killing people at the lifestone

fauna.name: Virindi Interrogator
fauna.treasure: Drops the Virindi Signet. Sometimes drops a Virindi Directive Key.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Quendor of Leafcull for stats & image.Thanks to Zen Tek Ken for updated info.

fauna.name: Ecorto the Lost Director (NPC)
fauna.comments: NPC Virindi found in Zakhail, he will summon a portal to the Seat of the New Singularity Dungeon (aka Virindi Shroud Dungeon) if given the right combination of Items.

fauna.name: Guardian of the Singularity
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Yellow Jewel or a Virindi Singularity Key. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Aesa for the image!

fauna.name: Unstable Rift
fauna.offense: Anti-drain and melee, so use War Magic for best effectiveness.
fauna.weakness: Possible Magic Defense: 325 Possible Magic Defense: 333 Possible Magic Defense: 333
fauna.comments: Thanks to Mad Prophet, Myuki Santoshi/Okura Santoshi, Quendor and Zyrca.

fauna.name: Virindi Profane
fauna.offense: Possible Attack Skill: 407 Possible Deception Skill: 375
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Yellow Jewel or a Virindi Singularity Key. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Quendor.

fauna.name: Northern Overseer
fauna.treasure: Drops three Northern Forge Essences, three Rings of Shielding, and the Inner Sea Directive

fauna.name: Virindi Inquisitor
fauna.offense: Very powerful magic attacks, high magic defense, hard hitting melee... Almost impervious (but not quite!) Possible Deception Skill: 400
fauna.weakness: Possible Magic Defense: 336 Possible Magic Defense: 296
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Broken Virindi Inquisitor Mask or a Virindi Singularity Key. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Mad Prophet, Jaguar, and Quendor.

fauna.name: The Sage
fauna.spoiler_general: Can only be killed by Missile Attacks

fauna.offense: Anti Drain / Melee, War magic works the best.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Mad Prophet for Magic Defense

fauna.comments: Spawns with a pod of Executors, Plated Tuskers (only place they are found)& Altered Drudges. Thanks to Archui for Level and Magic Defense.

fauna.spoiler_general: All rifts do a non-specific damage type.

fauna.comments: Thanks to Mad Prophet for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: Virindi Quidiox
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Mangled Dark Key, a Twisted Dark Key, a Virindi Singularity Key or a Yellow Jewel.

fauna.name: Virindi Paradox
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Mangled Dark Key, a Twisted Dark Key, a Virindi Singularity Key or a Yellow Jewel.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Yachi of Wintersebb for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: Carpenter Wasp
fauna.offense: Possible Missile Defense: 5 Possible Missile Defense: 9 Possible Attack Skill: 10
fauna.treasure: A Carpenter Wasp Wing good for 200 exp from the Academy Foreman (Limit 5)
fauna.comments: New creature added in the Dec 2001 patch. Occasionally drop Carpenter Wasp Wing.

fauna.name: Red Phyntos Wasp
fauna.offense: Fast and annoying. Young characters often have trouble escaping them. They tend to be found in groups of three or four.
fauna.treasure: About one in every 10 or 20 of these will have a prized Red Phyntos Wasp Wing. Collectors and Wing Collectors will pay well for them. Sometimes drops A Lucky Gold Letter.

fauna.name: Green Phyntos Wasp
fauna.offense: Fast and annoying. Young characters often have trouble escaping them. They tend to be found in groups of three or four Possible Attack Skill: 52 Possible Missile Defense: 87
fauna.treasure: Occasionally a small pile of pyreals or a couple spell components. On some occasions you might find a Green Phyntos Wasp Wing or a Lucky Gold Letter.

fauna.name: Blue Phyntos Wasp
fauna.offense: Fast and annoying. Young characters often have trouble escaping them. They tend to be found in groups of three or four. Possible Attack Skill: 60 Possible Melee Defense: 87
fauna.treasure: About one in every 10 or 20 of these will have a prized Blue Phyntos Wasp Wing. Collectors and Wing Collectors will pay well for them. Sometimes drops A Lucky Gold Letter.

fauna.name: Red Phyntos Drone
fauna.treasure: Occasionaly a Lucky Gold Letter
fauna.comments: New Creature added in the September 2001 patch. Thanks to GeorgeKG of Leafcull for stats.

fauna.name: Mire Phyntos Wasp
fauna.offense: Level III Fire Volleys & Bolts
fauna.treasure: Mire Phyntos Wasp Wing

fauna.name: Gold Phyntos Wasp
fauna.offense: Piercing tail-thrust attack, III and IV-level war magic. Prefers Lightning Volley IV and Lightning Bolt III before engaging in close combat. Possible Attack Skill: 254 Possible Attack Skill: 262
fauna.treasure: Gold Phyntos Wasp Wing, pyreals, magic and non-magic gems and jewelry, (rare) magic weapons.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Alextium of WE, and Uzi-El.
fauna.spoiler_general: Will fire volleys from a considerable distance. If it engages you, it usually won't give up until you or it is dead. Sometimes flies alone, but most often in trios.

fauna.name: Jungle Phyntos Wasp
fauna.offense: Lightning Volleys. Rarely found alone, is usually with several other Wasps.
fauna.treasure: Sometimes drops a Jungle Phyntos Wasp Wing. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Thanks Roberto.

fauna.name: White Phyntos Wasp
fauna.offense: Tends to cast Frost bolt/volley spells which is a bad thing considering the abundant nearby Banderlings casting Frost Vulns.
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops White Phyntos Wasp Wing. May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Optim Shi XP updated by Briciu.

fauna.name: Black Phyntos Wasp
fauna.offense: Casts lightning spells and uses a slash melee attack.

fauna.name: Banished Phyntos Wasp
fauna.treasure: Always drops Banished Crossbow.

fauna.name: Ethereal Wisp
fauna.offense: Mainly magical creatures they like to attack with drain and harm spells. Usually sticking to the level 1 version of these spells. Drain Health is particulary favored.
fauna.weakness: Given their low health one or two attacks are usually enough to slay them.
fauna.treasure: usually none
fauna.comments: Like most wisps, they tend to want to stand and use their spells, only closing to melee ranger after their mana is exhausted. Thanks to Mad Prophet for Magic Defense.

fauna.name: Water Wisp
fauna.offense: Wisps are magical creatures and therefore use mainly magical attacks. They like to drain stamina and mana and use harm other far too effectively.
fauna.weakness: Their low health makes them vulnerable to quick attacks since they often fall to only a few blows
fauna.comments: Mages, be carefull. They love drain mana and can be very annoying because of this.

fauna.name: Ghost Wisp
fauna.offense: Attacks by war (frost and lighting bolt III usually) or life spell (exhaustion and vulnerability mainly) and a slashing electrical attack.
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops Sickly Wisp Heart.
fauna.comments: The wisp will usually cast spells until its mana is exhausted. So keeping it at a range and forcing it to use up its mana is a great tactic. War magic can be easily dodged. Then close to melee range and finish it off quickly.

fauna.name: Dark Wisp
fauna.offense: unknown
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops Sickly Wisp Heart.
fauna.comments: unknown

fauna.name: Shadow Wisp
fauna.offense: Level V spells. Extremely resistant to most elemental attacks. Possible Deception Skill: 190
fauna.weakness: Relatively few hit points, if you can close in, they're fairly quick to take out.
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops Pulsating Wisp Heart.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Sauron's Bane, Long John Weasel of Frostfell, Bones the Huntsman, and Uzi-El. XP updated by Briciu.

fauna.name: Fire Wisp
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops a Pulsating Wisp Heart.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Khaine of Leafcull, Circeus, and Quendor.

fauna.name: Summoned Pulsar Wisp
fauna.comments: Thanks to meglo the maniac of WE for stats.

fauna.name: Stasis Wisp
fauna.comments: Thanks to Saberwolf of Leafcull for Stats & picture.

fauna.name: Cursed Wisp
fauna.weakness: Possible Magic Defense: 250 Possible Magic Defense: 285 Possible Magic Defense: 300
fauna.comments: Thanks to David the Meek of Leafcull for the stats!

fauna.name: Strife Wisp
fauna.comments: Submitted by Alextium of WE, Quendor, and Trai.

fauna.name: Essence of Strife
fauna.comments: Thanks to topheron for stats.

fauna.name: Corrosion Wisp
fauna.weakness: Physical attacks are best. Possible Melee Defense: 482
fauna.comments: Submitted by Alextium of WE

fauna.name: Tempest Wisp
fauna.comments: Thanks to Loki Ironhand, and Saberwolf for stats & pic submission.

fauna.name: Affliction Wisp
fauna.offense: It's a wisp. It casts many many many spells in rapid succession.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Vead, and Quendor. Thanks to Uzi-El for the pic!
fauna.spoiler_general: Possible Deception Skill: 314

fauna.name: Spectral Wisp
fauna.comments: Screenshot and level submitted by Harrower Grievver of Frostfell. Stats by Druideth

fauna.name: Nightmare Wisp
fauna.offense: Loves to cast drains and harms, or so it can sometimes seem.
fauna.treasure: Occasionally drops Glowing Wisp Heart.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Shizzu Shizzu for getting the initial data on this creature for us. Thanks to DaZ for magic defense.

fauna.name: Chaos Wisp
fauna.weakness: sligthly more vulnerable to physical attacks (slashing, piercing, bludgeon)
fauna.treasure: May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Jediknight II / Sim of Leafcull.

fauna.name: Entropy Wisp
fauna.comments: They are a random spawn fron clicking on Cultist Altars. Thanks to Meglo the Maniac of WE for stats.

fauna.name: Jibrit Zefir
fauna.comments: Thanks to Optim Shi.

fauna.name: Kilif Zefir
fauna.comments: Thanks to Optim Shi.

fauna.name: Zofrit Zefir
fauna.offense: Melee and Strong Magic Capabilities. Can cast high level magic spells.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Quendor.

fauna.name: Sufut Zefir
fauna.offense: Lots of War Spells, also a very respectable Melee Defense. Possible Attack Skill: 238
fauna.comments: Submitted by Uzi-El

fauna.name: Nalif Zefir
fauna.offense: This Zefir's melee attack is much stronger than the other smaller zefirs. The level VI war spells are very powerful too. Bludge works nicely.
fauna.treasure: May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: They move fast and can be on your back in an instant. Very hard to outrun, be careful around them

fauna.name: Azael Zefir
fauna.offense: War V & VI Spells & Harms. They tend to do Flame & Shockwave the most.
fauna.weakness: Seems weaker to physical attack particularly Bludgeoning.
fauna.treasure: May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Thanks to Jediknight II and Sim of Leafcull for stats and pic.

fauna.name: Enku Zefir
fauna.treasure: May drop a Sturdy Iron Key.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Luven the Grey

fauna.name: Dusk Zefir
fauna.comments: Thanks to Shobuck Jr for the stats Thanks to Maddy for the xp

fauna.name: Dark Zefir
fauna.comments: Level provided by Volition Thanks to Maddy for stats, magic d and xp

fauna.name: Malevolent Zefir
fauna.comments: Thanks to Trai and Genghis X for pics and stats

fauna.name: Atakir, the Dark Prince
fauna.offense: Casts Ire of the Dark Prince
fauna.treasure: Dagger: 6-12 425 skill/200 lore activate all lvl 6 spells and minors, biting strike, crushing blow AND multi-strike.
fauna.comments: Submitted by Sue Dark of SC - THANK YOU!
